Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: VickieChristie
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at the Milton. Staff were friendly and the room were cleaned on a daily basis. Can't really find much fault with our stay. Look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Only adequate”
Reviews.Author: Charmainee
Reviews.Content: Room is simple and feel and look like 3 stars. Train stop is just outside the hotel. So good as a base to travel out to the sightseeing places. Not much nice resturants near the hotel. The location is quite deserted and quiet at night. We didnt spent much time in the room so guess this hotel meets our minimum needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to Italian adventure”
Reviews.Author: Louise Cate C
Reviews.Content: A great hotel close to Colloseum, Forum etc. Had shuttle booked from airport, so conveniently dropped off and straight into room. We were able to walk, but a bus stop was outside front door also taxis available. Walked straight into Colloseum, Constantines Arch then onto Forum and war Memorial. As it was boxing day main streets were closed so got to stroll through Rome with no cars. Breakfast is a higher standard than most hotels, chocolate and custard croissants, Bella! Free wifi in lobby. Rooms quiet. Staff friendly but phrase book always handy. It was a great central location, if you like walking you can go through gardens as well with great views of Rome. Highly recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break and near to the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: Run_Lola
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a three day and night weekend in March. Don't be put off by the outside as it looks a little cheap - not so much like the picture they give above! But once you step inside, you will be greeted warmly by reception staff who speak a number of different languages and are happy to help. We had a standard double bed room. There was a comfy bed, desk, chair, mini bar, wardrobe and a decent flatscreen TV attached to the wall. The bathroom was small but there was a bath in there. It was a little annoying that the toilet was located behind the door but a small problem. There was a slight toilet smell in there from time to time but only mild. I would advise taking a pair of earplugs as if you are located facing out onto one of the two busy streets, you will hear a lot during the night with trams and other traffic. It was rather warm in the room but this may have been because it was in between seasons so the heating may have been on when not needed some days. The wi-fi connection was really flaky in the rooms so using the lobby might be wise. The room was kept spotlessly clean which was great. Breakfast was very pleasant. Hot food could have been hotter at times but the selection was brilliant - cereals, toast, croissants, bacon and scrambled eggs, meats, cheese, rolls, bread, cakes, fruit and yoghurt. The coffee machine was excellent and there was a good selection of fruit juices. We walked from Termini (the main train station) and it took about 25 minutes to get to the hotel which was reasonable. For location to the Colosseum and Roman Forum, its pretty unbeatable. 8 minute walk at most. Go and see this at night when it is all lit up. And in the day walk to the top of the Palantine gardens to get a photo of the whole of the Colosseum (a worthwhile tip I read in my city secrets book!) The metro station Manzini is literally opposite the hotel which made things very easy to get the Trevi fountain and The Pantheon. Would recommend taking the metro to the Vatican or you will be in for a long walk! Buy a day ticket for the metro which is cheap as chips but beware that you need a 5 euro note or change for the machines. Can recommend restaurants Li Rione on Via dei SS. Quattro Coronati and Hostaria Isidoro on Via di San Giovanni. They are both located five minutes from the Colosseum. Would highly recommend the chicken in gorgonzola sauce at Hostaria!

Reviews.Title: “Mosty good but with a few reservations”
Reviews.Author: Rose of England R
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. First disappointment was no kettle in spite of this having been checked out with our Travel Agent beforehand. When I queried why it was still on the website the receptionist told me that they had decided against kettles that very day! This was obviously not true as I have now read other reviews. It's a pity to have someone lie - it destroys confidence. We know Rome quite well so knew where to go to buy a kettle. There are two supermarkets in the Termini station, just two Metro stops away. Location was ideal for us - as we like to walk and the Forum and Coliseum and several important churches were within a short stroll. The Metro is simple to use as there are only 2 lines and most of the tourist sites are situated on Line A - outside the front door. Our bed was extremely comfortable and we were not disturbed by the traffic noise. If you want a peaceful retreat don't go to a major city. This is about our tenth visit to Rome and we have had much much noisier rooms in other hotels. Our double room was Ok in size, but our son's single room made me recall that this was once a convent as it was similar to a monastic cell. However, the lighting in our room was among the best I have found anywhere in the world. This is very important for ageing eyes wanting to read small print in travel guides. Well done on that, Hotel Milton. The breakfast was extensive with pretty well everything you could imagine including scrambled egg and bacon. However on the last 3 mornings this was so cold as to be inedible. The linen was very clean, and the room was serviced regularly. The staff were generally helpful and requests eg for a chair in the room, were dealt with fairly quickly. There are several restaurants and cafes in the roads around and we were able to dine well in different places each night. The bar opposite makes a good cup of tea. We would stay there again as we wanted a clean and convenient base from which to explore. It suited us well.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: Sindiibad
Reviews.Content: We had a great few days at The Milton close to center & freindly team thank you :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a flying visit”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo_Goater
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in February - Greeted warmly on arrival by very friendly and helpful staff, the room was spacious (for a Roman hotel!) clean and modern looking. We didn't have any problems with noise, and having been to Rome a number of times before, I can appreciate that this can be an issue, but no problems for us on this occasion. It is about a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum, so not bad for a day spent around there and the Forum, but it is quite a way from Piazza Navona, Campo De Fiori etc... however the Manzoni Metro station is outside the front door. There are many horror stories about the metro, particularly around Termini, but Manzoni is not a busy station, the ticket machines are in English, and everything tourist-y is along the same line, so all you need to do is get on and get off, no transferring trains required! We used this to reach the Vatican museums & Spanish Steps on different days, and then meandered back towards the hotel, which was ideal. The only slight let down was the breakfast, which was fairly basic, plus coffee out of a vending machine, so we abandoned this for a lovely little coffee bar - head down Via Emanuele Filiberto, towards San Giovanni, and it is about 4/5 doors down. Other than that, great room, great service, and a great base to enjoy the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Firendly Staff, In the Center of Rome..”
Reviews.Author: Mohamad A
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Friendly Staff, In the Center of Rome..close to all sites, Just beside a Metro Station..10 Seconds from hotel doorstep... Near a bus stop as well as a Tram. Clean Rooms/Restaurant... Helpful staff, reasonable room rates. recommended..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Bettand34
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milton is close to the central station but closer to the Colosseum, with plenty of shops and places to eat nearby. We never paid more than 7 euros by taxi to get anywhere in the central area of Rome. The rooms were spotless and the service first class, thankyou for accommodating us!

Reviews.Title: “Half term in rome”
Reviews.Author: luke38257
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, close to all amenities, making it ideal for site seeing. The staff were all very pleasant, and the room was ok.. It was clean and comfortable but Unfortunately there were no Tea/Coffee facilities in the room and the the advertised satellite TV consisted of 3 Italian channels 1 German and CNN, not ideal when traveling with a child. Not quite sure how it qualified for 4 stars, as I have stayed in 2 and 3 star properties that have had more facilities. I wouldn't recommend it if taking children or you are used to true 4 star properties.

Reviews.Title: “Four Days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: OxfordCrew
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Manzoni Metro station and Bus and Tram lines so is well positioned to access other parts of the city. Although we had a room overlooking the main crossroads it was not noisy and we slept well. It might be different in the summer if one needed open windows. Staff were all pleasant and helpful apart from the breakfast room on Sunday morning which seemed a bit under staffed and as it was busy was not serviced as were the other days. Breakfast food and choices was very good. The Bar was not opened unless we asked for it to be and when we returned to the hotel about 9:45 on Sunday evening we found the bar was closed 'as the Barman did not work on Sundays'. Fortunately a small bar across the road was able to accomodate us and several other Milton Roma guests. We would stay again as it was clean, comfortable and we enjoyed our stay despite the Snow.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Milton 02.2012”
Reviews.Author: Anna_LuciaMoscow
Reviews.Content: It’s a second time I have stayed at this hotel! Very good location: close to metro Manzoni, near bus stop, 15min walk to Colosseo, 20min walk to Termini station. There is a mini market with local food in front of the hotel. The hotel is very nice and clean, my room was very quiet. Very good and various breakfast. The price of the hotel was fantastic for a 4 stars hotel! The staff is very friendly. I was assisted in everything. My stay was wonderful! I’m sure to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Experience......”
Reviews.Author: Sophie W
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a very convenient location, metro which is easy and cheap to use is across the road. Rooms clean, breakfast excellent and the staff are very friendly with great English. Only draw back was the street noise. You will struggle if you are a light sleeper. Ear plugs were enough for me to block the background noise. If you are just looking for a base for your trip then the Milton is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Kalephrrr
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very conveniently located across the street from Manzoni metro station! Breakfast is excellent! Staff is helpful and courteous, great English. Only cons are that it is slightly on the outskirts of major attractions; there are few restaurants nearby; the street noise and trolley noise on Via Emanuele Filberto are horrible! If you want to sleep past 6:00 am, then this is not your place. Overall had a great stay there, and for the money, you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “A good base for a trip to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Liniredbaron
Reviews.Content: This hotel will serve as an excellent base for a trip to Rome. The hotel is clean and the rooms are spacious and private. The hotel is located next to a tube station and around 10 minutes walk from the coliseum. Great if you need a place to stay for a weekend city break.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - staff unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: sespencer30
Reviews.Content: Four star hotel with no kettle or tea making facilities in room, despite this part of the room description and in photos on their website.. when I asked the staff we rude and said they dont have kettles. So I asked for a coffee to be sent up bit no refreshments available until 7pm at night! I did find the staff generally unhelpful and uninterested, they spent the day on the front desk browsing on the internet! Our room was VERY NOISY as many others have pointed out. Also I would say the location isnt very good - although close to a metro station they metro network isnt great in Rome. Also 10 minute walk to the colosseum and forum but I would say not within walking distance to pretty much everything else in Rome, including a good selection of restaurants. Saying all this the room was clean, breakfast good, just perhaps not a 4-star hotel worth the price they charge..

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and great service”
Reviews.Author: iczi
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Milton Roma. In fact, we only booked it for the first lag of our trip and was gonna look for another hotel in Rome on the second half of the trip but we ended up just booking with them because we really enjoyed it! 1. Hotel is extremely convenient and located in a relatively safe neighbourhood. It was important for 2 girls traveling in Europe. It is located two stops away from Termini train station which is pretty shady, but the station it is located right above is Manzoni, situated in a quiet Italian neighbourhood with everything you need within 5 minutes - Cafe across the street, drug store, cheese and deli store, local pub, bus stop to Colosseum (or a 10 mins walk) 2. Both rooms we stayed at were at a comfortable size, especially in a large city. The bathrooms were clean but there was no door so showering was kind of interesting to try to keep the water in the tub. The first time we flooded the bathroom because we werent aware, however everything else in the room we had no complaints for. 3. Wifi is only available in the lobby for a cost, it wasn't a big issue for us because there were a lot of internet cafes located in Rome. No real amenities except the small hotel bar. Very neat and clean. Both our rooms faced the "busy street" however it gets very quiet at night and we did hear a few trucks going by in the morning. 4. Service was absolutely great. I think with any country the key is to try and learn/adapt to their customs. We had an Italian app on our iphone and tried to check in speaking Italian even all concierges we encountered speaks fluent English. They were all extremely helpful in teaching/helping us with our Italian and any general info on Rome. While we were there, a lady checked in speaking only in English rudely and not bothering with adapting to any Italian mannerism and the concierge was cold and impolite. I think you give and you take. 5. The breakfast buffet was also absolutely amazing! Best one in Europe by far. It has a relatively large selection of juice, a coffee machine (however can be more amazing seeing we were in Italy), danishes, desserts, deli meats, cheese, veggies, cereal, yogurt and other breakfast foods. Some reviews said that food was almost always gone, which didn't happen to us the 3 nights we were there. The staffs are very attentive and replenishes quickly. Overall, I am sure there were a million other hotels in Rome that can be more amazing, but for the price we got (about $130USD maybe?) it was a great stay and well worth the price. I would recommend it to all travelers on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: davidojs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, and can thoroughly say I did NOT enjoy my stay; and this is by no means a four star hotel. I was traveling alone, and had booked a double room (for some reason this was less expensive), rather then a single. I was shocked to find that this so called "double" room, felt cramped and claustrophobic, this was only enhanced by the scratch marks and scuffs adorning the walls. The room also lacked certain amenities you would expect from a four star hotel like table lamps and chairs. That evening, when I had wanted to go take the metro, I asked the staff if the could break a 10 euro bill into two 5 euro bills for me to use the ticket machine. Thinking this was a FOUR star hotel, I figured this would be no problem. However, I was shocked to find that they claimed the could not help me at all, that they had "no" cash (hard to believe especially because this hotel has a bar) and my only option was to buy from the drug store across the street. My lovely stay ended by finding that my the adjustable shower head in my room would not stay up, so I had to crouch to the floor of the shower to get my head wet. One positive aspect about my stay however, was the breakfast, which had a fairly large selection.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: mickpg
Reviews.Content: Is not properly a four star hotel. Located in central position, very closet to colosseum and S. Giovanni square, above metro station called “Manzoni”. I stayed in a queen sized bed room faced on the main street, very noisy during the day. I had some accident with the shower and with the bathroom in general, because there wasn’t a mechanical air exchange. The breakfast included fresh fruit, eggs and bacon, many cakes, but the temperature in the dining room was too low, quite similar to the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Typical hotel in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: KATZ210511
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in mid November 2011. The first thing we noticed as soon as we walked into our room was the offensive smell of sewerage coming from the bathroom, but we were told by friends that this is common in hotels of Rome so we kept our room window open as much as we could. The room we were allocated was snug, having a double bed, desk and chair and closet. No wi-fi internet available in room, only in the lobby. However, Wi-Fi is complimentary. Another downside is the noise pollution! I had to wear ear plugs to geta good nights sleep. Traffic and sirens can keep you up all night otherwise. Reception staff were very friendly and were able to communicate in English. Location wise, it is not so obviously well positioned but it is within walking distance to monuments such as the Colloseum and the Basilica of San Marjorie, as well as restaurants and supermarkets. Furthermore, there is a metro station right at its doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, adequate, but too noisy and not very romantic”
Reviews.Author: culturaDJ
Reviews.Content: This a good hotel if you're not looking for anything romantic or special. It basically fullfills all your needs, at a very decent price. So it that is ok for you, look no further and stop reading. Go and enjoy. The breakfast is simple but adequate and it will release you from having to breakfast outside somewhere. Don't expect freshly made croissants though. The room was spotless (except for the rather worn carpets). They must have revamped it recently, all the walls and the bath looked really freshly painted and clean. We had a room overlooking the main street, and wow, that is noisy. Sure, after a day wandering through Rome, you'll sleep anyway, as did we. But if noise keeps you awake easily, ask for a room on the side of the hotel away from the street. Trams thunder by till pas midnight and since the claxon was probably invented in Rome, you'll hear a lot of it in the early morning. The staff is great. They are very helpfull and courteous. Well done! The Manzoni Metro is right in front, but since the metro is not running after 9pm (till april 2012, due too work in progress) or does not reach the old city, it is not much use. But hey, this hotel is 750 meter from The Collosseum. The location is far from idyllic on a main roundabout with huge amounts of Roman (!) traffic, next time I will opt for something in the old town for romantic reasons. But overall, this hotel is what you expect of a standard, well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, location and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: As I fractured my hip in Rome my husband and I stayed at Hotel Milton for 6 weeks. The Staff were superb and went out of their way to make us comfortable. They were friendly, knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Housekeeping was exemplary and nothing was too much trouble..We enjoyed the large selection of breakfast dishes and the fresh fruit platters and home made cakes were wonderful. A truly professional team, we highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel - no wifi in rooms, 1 towel in bathroom, no business centre, carpets filthy, bed linen worn.”
Reviews.Author: Claudia_za
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay in Central Rome near public transport for a one week work trip. I prepaid for this hotel because it was independent and because of the predominantly positive reviews on TripAdvisor. I checked the hotel website to make sure it would have the ammenities I need to work (wifi in the rooms and the ability to print documents if necesssary) and was reassured. On arrival I was told that there was no wifi and my reference to the website text was met with disinterest. The room contained a single bed with tired bedding, and was 2m by 3m large. As I was due to spend much time in the room working during my week long stay, I asked to upgrade to a larger double room but was told this was not possible. This is a 2.5 star hotel centrally located with a generous adequate breakfast. I am angry to have been missold.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but basic”
Reviews.Author: oliverlohan
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel for location with fantastic staff all of which are kind and helpful. However for the price I would expect more as a pretty frequent hotel user. Great for colosseum and for historical parts of Rome but I think you could find more bang for your buck elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: PhilParker12
Reviews.Content: Bad location. Bad service - our AC didn't work. They told us they fixed it but hadn't. Eventually they just gave us a new room. This room was better but it felt dirty. Tiny bar area that was deserted. Not a great experience. I don't recommend staying here, we won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptably noisy at night if you're in a room facing the street”
Reviews.Author: WorldWandererUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok but ONLY if you get a room at the back. My first night at the front was so noisy that I hardly slept (Room 317 above Via Emanuele Filiberto). I was so annoyed that I even tried to move rooms at 2am but was told there wasn’t a quiet one available – so that guaranteed a sleepless night at a 4 star rate! I did, however, move to the rear for the second night which was SO much quieter. The Milton’s windows at the front are double glazed, but the noise insulation is absolutely abysmal due to sound coming through the frames. The road outside had extremely noisy squeaky trams, mopeds and police sirens until at least 02:30. The Milton needs to invest in high quality sound-proofed windows at the front – after all there’s no point in forking out for a 4 star hotel if you can’t get any sleep. Even though I was clearly unhappy at not havng slept, not once did any of the reception staff apologise – it appeared to be more of an inconvenience to them rather than me! I moved across the road to the The Hotel President for the rest of my stay they were able to accommodate all of my colleagues and me at the quiet side of that hotel. One other negative was the showers. The shower head is bizarrely fitted to the side opposite the small shower screen on the bath meaning the water sprays across to the oppostite side around the screen and onto the floor. If you shower with the head attached, you’re likely to have a flood of water on the floor – I feel sorry for the cleaners who must be constanly finding puddles in the rooms! The breakfast was fine and the rooms were clean so in conclusion, if you’re not facing the road side you’ll be ok. But be prepared for a sleepless miserable night if you are facing the trams – unless you’re deaf of course.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and breakfast, nice stuff but expected better rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ElenaSal
Reviews.Content: Well it depends what are you searching for in your vacation. 1. Location - very very good. Milton hotel is in great location, near the colloseum (on feet 10 minutes), near bus station that can get you easily in the most hot spots of the town. 2. Breakfast - great Great breakfast also and fresh, with variety of cakes. I enjoyed it. 3. stuff - good Sufficient Knowledge of english that allows you to understand the information the stuff gives you, which is a good thing in Rome Polite and willing to help you. I would like a better knowledge of sightseeing and directions 4. Rooms, definately not for a four star hotel. There is a lot of dust in the carpender, it could and should be much cleaner from dust. Windows dont open. Quite small room, considering that it is a four star hotel, but its not annoying. in conclusion, I would recommended it if its not problem of the dust mentioned above...

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Joobert
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Milton Roma for 3 nights during the first two weeks of September 2011. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were happily greeted and promptly checked in. The gentleman helping us provided us maps and explained, in detail, how to get to the main attractions easily and even provided areas to avoid at night, all without us even asking! The hotel is a bit older, but is nonetheless clean and maintained. When we entered our room we were pleasantly surprised! The room was quite spacious, despite what we've heard about European hotel size. Overall, the room was clean. However, the carpet near the bathroom was water damaged/stained. Speaking of the bathroom, the shower was a bit difficult to shower in. There was a glass partition that only shielded half of the tub and could be swung in/out from the tub. This being said, you had to shower at the one end of the tub that was shielded, while directing the spray of the water towards the shower wall to avoid getting water on the floor. Aside from this minor inconvenience, the bathroom was clean, had plenty of hot water and good water pressure. Man oh man! What an amazing location this hotel has! A 10 minute walk from the Colosseum, right beside a subway station and a bus stop nearby! In addition to this, there is a little cafe across the street to grab a nibble and drink. Just a few doors down is a cheese and deli shop where you can pick up some olives, cheese, prosciutto, a loaf of bread and some wine for a rustic meal. In terms of service, we were always happily greeted whenever we came in or left by the staff. They patiently listened while we awkwardly tried out the Italian phrases we knew and they even taught us some phrases too! The breakfast buffet that was provided in our booking package was hot, plentiful and large in variety! I highly recommend this hotel! Fantastic location and amazing value for their kind services!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: cp_0010
Reviews.Content: We were there last year in Sept.The hotel is in a good location. There is a metro station just across the road. Colosseum is at about 5-7 minutes walking distance. Other places can be reached by metro or hop on hop off bus. We had booked a double room for two nights. The reception staff gave us a very small room on the ground floor not suitable for two people, this was despite booking the room more than 2 months before. When enquired with hotel staff,the staff at the reception was rude and said they can not provide any other room however can refund the amount if we ask. This was a strange experience for us and didn't know where to go. So we had no choice but to take that room, on our request they changed the room next day to a better room. Breakfast was served on the ground floor and was very good with plenty of choices. There was hardly any help available from the hotel for any sightseeing tour however they can guide you to Colosseum. The hotel and room were in good condition.

Reviews.Title: “great Location”
Reviews.Author: moANDakila
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a lovely breakfast, agree the carpets do need changing.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugEddie
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome many times but on my last two visits I stayed at Hotel Milton, which has now become a favorite. I love that it's about a ten minute walk from the Colosseum and right across the street from the Manzoni metro station. Rooms and bathrooms are a decent size and the breakfast is outstanding with scrambled eggs, cold cuts, mini croissants, cereal and fresh fruit. The employees working at the front desk are always very helpful and even recognized me from the last time when I stayed there. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: supertopfit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located , close to the metro and bus station. However it s quite noisy due to the main street in front of the hotel. The Coliseum is at 10 min. The room was ok but the bathroom was small. The breakfast is good and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel (if you are lucky)”
Reviews.Author: michsyw
Reviews.Content: So this was our first trip to Rome and we booked this hotel based on the positive reviews here. We stayed for 2 nights and the experience was great. Very good breakfast, excellent location, and friendly staffs. So we decided to stay here again after we get back from our cruise trip. All things just went downhill. At first they gave us a corner unit away from the main building, and directly across from the staff room, you can hear people going in and out every 2 minutes and speaking quite loudly. We demanded to change room after a while, they are nice enough to gave us another room in the main building. And this one is a little better, except everything in the shower seems broken. The towel hanger seemed it could fall off any second, the showerhead holder was loose so you have to either hold it or lean it against the wall. If you take shower longer than 3 min, the spilled water will sneak around the toilet and drench the carpet outside the bathroom. And also the room we had seemed to be quite close to the main road outside, and everytime when a train or a bus went by, the floor started trembling. I would give this hotel a 5 star based on my first stay, and 2 star on my second. So a split calls for 3. It's a decent hotel, if you are lucky enough. Additional info: There's a 24 hour vending station just across the street from the hotel, they sell cheaper stuff than most of the stores here. Grocery store is about 200-300 meters from the hotel and of course their drinks are the cheapest. It's about 10min walk to the colosseum. The hotel's internet connection is pretty fast, haven't tried the wireless though.

Reviews.Title: “Milton Roma Hotel Below Average For Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: Ipsen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milton Roma Hotel in Rome first week in August 2011,i read most of the reviews some good and some not so good but decided to take a chance.The reviews were correct it had good points and bad. Firstly its within easy walking distance from the Termini Train Station which has a good link to FCO Airport so this made the transfere cheap and easy,the Colosseum is only 10 mins walk and the Roman Fort 5 mins from there. On arrival the staff were friendly and helpfull as we found througout our stay.Our room was adequate but a little tired looking,the air con worked a treat which is a must and the running water was hot and had a good pressure,the bed was large and comftable and had enough storage space a key coded safe was located in the wardrobe. We questioned the clenliness of the carpet and this was confirmed when our little boy spilled some juice, we tried to clean the spillage and was disscusted with the condition of the towel afterwards the only way to describe the carpet is filthy !!!!! The room was serviced every day but not cleaned,towels and toiletries replaced. In the morning the breakfast was good a great cup of coffee and lots of choice but be aware if you like bacon in the morning forget it its not the best ive tasted. No other food was served during the day but this wasnt a problem as there are lots of Resteraunts close by and an excellent snack bar on the opposite corner. In general the hotel was reasonable but not 4 star standard,it was ok for a few days but not for a long stay and basically you get what you pay for,i would recomend it for its good points but have a look around first before you book

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel...It should be 3 star though”
Reviews.Author: VasilisLeo
Reviews.Content: + : Good breakfast excellent location quiet neighborhood helpful staff - : Few facilities for a 4 star hotel trash bucket without lid at the toilet value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel ... but noisy”
Reviews.Author: James_DCFC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Roma Milton in July. The hotel is across the street from the Manzoni Metro station - which closes at 9pm. There is a bus stop close by. Hotel staff are really helpful. Breakfast is good and there is a big choice. We stayed in room 109. It was very noisy - non stop traffic outside all nite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Chubster_22
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a nice location 3/4 of a mile from the Colosseum. Friendly staff, small showers, right next to the metro station for easy travel. Tours that they helped set up were fine, not great, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a tourist visit to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: ThomasGBG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated 15 min walk from Coloseum. Good connections with Metro and buses. Clean and nice rooms. Friendly staff. Internet in the room only by cable, not WiFi. The breakafast is OK but could have been better. An ok place to stay for a Rome visit

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: louisefoley4
Reviews.Content: On check in the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, our room was one of the larger ones as we were booked in as a honeymoon couple. The bathroom was miniscule and the door would hit the toilet as you opened it. The shower head wouldn't stay up properly so showering was awkward and caused the bathroom to flood. Our bedroom window faced the street and the noise from traffic was unbelievable! When I asked to have these problems fixed we had our rooms changed, to one half the size! The room was a shoebox and not what we payed for. Wifi is not available in the rooms, only in the lobby and costs €5 per day. The breakfast was ok but on several occasions during the week I spotted rotting fruit (oranges, kiwis, apricots and at the end of the week the watermelon). This is completely unacceptable for any establishment calling themselves a four star hotel. The only good thing about the hotel was the location. Close to the coloseum and a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: cbw230
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for 3 nights. We checked in at 10 pm and were greated friendly. The staff was very helpful. The room was clean and had everything we needed. We especially valued the air condition. The bathroom was small but modern, the shower roomy. Our room was toward via emanuele filiberto but since it was hot we didn't open the windows anyway. The bed was very comfortable and we slept soundly. It was fairly quiet at night. We were surprised by the variety of breakfast options. There was something for everyone and no complaints whatsoever. The hotel is conveniently located across the metro stop and truly only a 15-20 minute walk from the collosseum. A great ice cream place (G. Fassi) is located a 5-10 minute walk away. The day of our check-out we were able to leave our luggage at the front desk until we had to leave for the airport. Again, the staff was very friendly and helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “A fair price for a fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Drifters2011
Reviews.Content: We read reviews on here before we booked and found it helpful. The following was true for our stay (we are a couple who were on a 3 night stay and wanted to see all the sights for an affordable price): Friendly and helpful check-in desk staff - gave great suggestion for local restaurant. Air-conditioning switches didn't work in room, however could be controlled from front desk when requested (bit of a pain but easily worked around). Small room but comfortable bed and clean bedding/towels, changed daily, lots of storage and a safe. Large, clean and modern bathroom however, as other travellers on here found, the 'wetroom' shower set-up meant that water seeps out onto carpet of main room - not a problem when it's not your own home to worry about though! Great location - opposite 'Manzoni' metro so convenient (although metro closing at 9pm at present due to new line being built so a bit of a walk to main areas in evening when feet are hot from lots of walking all day). Some reviews said noisy, but no worse than any other city hotel, didn't affect our sleep. Breakfast fabulous - everything you could want, freshly made, self-service. 10/15 minute walk down to Colleseum or 20 mins walk up to main train station. All in all we found that it was ideal for a reasonable priced stay in a busy city with good metro links.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: OneAverageJoe
Reviews.Content: The hotel exterior and interior lobby and restaurant area were well kept and comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly. Overall this was a nice hotel without any glaring issues. At the same time, it wasn't extraordinary in any way. The high point of this hotel is its daily breakfast, which was excellent. The low point would have to be the room decor, which was very plain and uninviting. The locaion of the Hotel was good, especially since it sits right next to a metro station. My rating would be 3.5 stars. If the rooms were updated (more welcoming decor, larger televisions, etc) then I would give it a solid 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Look for a better option”
Reviews.Author: Chathamjack
Reviews.Content: We spent the last two nights at the Hotel Milton following our cruise. We were disappointed. Small rooms, minimal furnishings, sketchy neighborhood. Staff was really nice and great breakfast. Bottomline, find a better option.

Reviews.Title: “excellent breakfast, next to metro stop, excelletn hotel”
Reviews.Author: julesr101
Reviews.Content: <10 min walk to colloseum but on edge of the central city area. Right next to the metro though so not a problem for getting about as the metro is cheap (1 euro per journey) and regular. If you are one of those people who like to explore the city on foot only then staying somewhere more central may be better. However I suspect you won't get such a nice hotel for the price. <10 mins from Termini station for easy access to the airport - be aware though that if you get the airport bus to Ciampino then it only goes at certains times, not every 10mins (as we thought!) so if you miss the bus its a 30 euro cab ride to the airport. Good sized rooms, clean and comfy beds. Staff friendly and helpful. Brealfast was included which was a buffet but excellent quality and choice. Was great to start the day without having to go looking for somewhere to eat first and get straight to sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to Metro and Exceptionally competent and nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: BillRaimond
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent for Metro stop Manzoni which is only two stops from Termini. The hotel was clean and well run. The reception staff was excellent, especially Rosaria and Fabio, who were always a pleasure to deal with. The Breakfast was always good and well stocked with many items. The Breakfast personnel were all very capable and nice, especially Maria, Crezia, and Erica. They were all great and made our stay a real pleasure. This hotel is very lucky to have such good personnel working there. Although the room size was not large, the bed was comfortable. Although the internet was not free, it was not overpriced and the wired internet in the room worked well. Our overall experience at the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Practically perfect”
Reviews.Author: B0bfr0mbrum
Reviews.Content: A great location first of all - just half a mile from the famous colosseum and right next to a metro station. The hotel was clean and tidy with attentive staff who went out of their way to speak to all the guests in their own language! Very impressive. There is a fantastic buffet laid on for breakfast every morning - quite sweetly while we were there it was Easter and there was a giant chocolate egg smashed up and ready to nibble on with your coffee over breakfast! The hotel is lcoated close to lots of restaurants literally within minutes of walking left or right. You really can't go wrong. The one slight downside is you are located on an extremely busy traffic crossroads, but you soon get used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; an adequate facility, but very nice for the purpose of our travel.”
Reviews.Author: drnordin
Reviews.Content: We traveled on a Best of Italy tour, and stayed here for our first two nights in Rome. It is within walking distance to the Colosseum, great coffee shops, stores, and restaurants. Rosaria at the front desk was especially friendly and helpful. She steered us to two local restaurants which were two of the best three we found in Italy. If you are looking for Marriott or Courtyard quality, you won't find it here, but as a walking base for sampling what Rome has to offer, it is hard to beat,

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: thov4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is across the street from a metro station (2 stops from the main train station), so if you're going to get around Rome via metro this location would work for you. I preferred to walk around the city, and this was just a bit too far from the center of town. That being said, we did it several times, but we left in the morning and came back at night. I would have liked to have the ability to go back to my room to take breather or drop off bags. The hotel is very clean and looks like any business type hotel. Kind of reminds of a Marriott. The staff was helpful, except for some reason they don't allow irons in your room. The bathroom has one of those half doors on the tub. Maybe Europeans know how to use this, but whatever I do, I get the whole bathroom soaking wet after a shower. The breakfast ok. As other reviewers have stated the eggs and bacon were not appetizing, but you did have choice of fruit, cakes, cereal and yogurt.

Reviews.Title: “Milton Hotel, Adequate”
Reviews.Author: disey05
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in Rome. The hotel would not be considered a 4 star hotel in Ireland. We had 2 triple bedrooms on different floors. The were a okay for our needs but the street noise made it difficult to go to sleep. Bed linen and towels were changed. Breakfast was poor by any standards. Buffet style Bacon and egg was not inviting. I still can't get over sweet cakes for Breakfast! My main complaint was having to pay a tax on checking out. This was introduce in Rome in Jan 2011. Two nights cost us an extra €33 for a party of 5. This tax is supposedly to improve tourism in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A clean GREAT Value”
Reviews.Author: Ima711
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in this converted monastery located about1Km, an easy walking distance from the heart of Ancient Rome and the Colloseum. It includes a generous breakfast buffet which is great especially considering the high price of meals on Rome and the breakfast buffet is from 7 to 10:30. The subway / tram/ and bus stops are right across the street making everything totally accessible. The rooms are modest in size as are most hotels in European cities and the bathroom is small, but that is hardly a deal breaker for anyone. The only drawback is that the rooms facing the front of this corner building are incredibly noisy from the outside street noises so sleeping with an open window is pretty much impossible. Rosaria and Fabio at the desk are excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Chrisch79
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in quite a good location, but there are a few things that could be addressed. The wiif is *extremely* expensive, and it took 10 minutes just to load Google - as it seems the router it connects to isn't even in the same building. When we asked the staff for a map (or even to show us where we were on one that we had found), they pretended that they couldn't speak English. I then surprised them by speaking to them in Italian, and they just ignored me. The next day when the remainder of the tour group arrived (including the tour director), the staff could then magically speak English and were happy to help... Like another reviewer on here, we too were unable to prevent water from flowing onto the carpet - as the glass screen was fitted to the wrong end of the bath/shower, and as it didn't extend the whole way along, it was useless. There was some quite beautiful music that we could here in the rooms, coming from down the street, at 5pm every day... Not sure what it was, but it was quite lovely - if you stay here, open your window at 5pm and have a listen! :)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again but some issues need addressing...”
Reviews.Author: walker43
Reviews.Content: Location is fairly good - right opposite a tube station that will take to the vatican, spanish steps, main train station (termini) etc (watch out for pick pockets - my wallet went missing). Only 15 mins walk to collesseum and the forum etc. It is quite possible to walk all over from this hotel if you are fairly fit. Breakfast is fine if you like cakes and fruit - the bacon and scrambled egg were poorly cooked and only luke warm - rather unpleaseant. Coffee is a serve yourself affair from a vey poor machine - I cant remember having had a worse coffee for years, strange in a country where they take pride in their coffee. Boiled eggs and cold meats were ok. Don't come here if breakfast is the most important part of your stay in a hotel. Rooms were very good - at least ours was, clean, fresh towels, fairly large with a safe and all mod cons. Only drawback was the noise from the roads outside (very busy), but this could have been aleviated if the windows had shut firmly. Staff were friendly enough when you came into contact with them but I wouldn't say that service was this hotels strongest point. To sum up - we would stay here again since it was such good value through expedia (£600 for 4 nights incl flights from bristol uk) and if we could get a quieter room. We spent the vast majority of our time out of the hotel which you will probably do too. The vast majority of the places we went to were free - vatican, spanish steps, pantheon, trevi fountain etc, and the churches were all full of fantastic works of art, so sightseeing will not break the bank. Restaurants and cafes in the centre of Rome will charge 6 or 8 euros for a very small beer or coffee, so be warned. Slightly out of the centre the prices fall rather and are much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: ForeverYoung50
Reviews.Content: Our small room had worn carpets, grubby walls, was sparsely furnished and not very nice. The bathroom was terrible. It was small and the shower head was broken and kept falling down so we had to tie it up as best we could. When having a shower, we were unable to stop water flooding the floor which in turn, soaked the carpet outside in the room. The room was hot but opening a window wasn't an option as the street noise from the busy corner (trams and cars) was too loud. The location was alright as far as getting to the Colosseum and Forum and even Roma Termini was within 15 minutes walk. There's also a subway station across the street. However, there weren't any decent eateries close-by only a small coffee shop on the opposite corner with so-so food. The service at this hotel was fine and the front desk helpful, but the biggest complaint we had was the breakfast. The only way to describe it was awful! Their coffee machine served the worst coffee we had in all of Italy, it was dreadful! This and the very limited menu choice meant we looked for breakfast elsewhere the next morning .. even though breakfast was included in our rate. On checkout, we discovered we had to pay a tax of 3 euros per person per night for staying in 4 and 5 star hotels in Rome. As we didn't consider the Milton Roma to be 4 star, this was adding insult to injury!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Across the street from the subway”
Reviews.Author: Smurfette081
Reviews.Content: Room was not so bright and not very clean. Free wifi. Nothing special. Size? It's great compared to most hotels in Rome. Great breakfast. Love the yoghurt. Hotel is located right across the street from the subway which line takes you to most of the city's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, great location, free breakfast is amazing”
Reviews.Author: KER14886
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Milton in Rome for 10 days last week. The hotel was exceptional and made the trip for me. It was a great location with many places within walking distance and, for those that weren't the metro was right outside the front door. The room, though tiny, was comfortable and clean. The staff was always friendly and helpful. They really went out of their way to make me feel like I was at home. And the breakfast buffet was phenomenal. That alone was worth the price of the room. Amazing selections and it all tasted great too. And the breakfast room lent itself to getting to know your fellow travelers. From reviews I read before the trip, I went up the street about half a block to use a more economical internet cafe, rather than the hotel's service. Also discovered a great little restaurant up that same street.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reddickie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great long weekend in Rome, the location of the hotel ideal with the metro just across the street,and many sights within ten minutes walk. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and always willing to offer advise. The rooms were good value for the money. The buffet breakfast was very good with lots of choice. I will be returning to this hotel in the future!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: looking4adventure20
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Sept. 2009. Excellent location, across the street from the metro. The metro is very easy to nagivate. Excellent buffet breakfast. There is a computer available in the lobby for guest to use. It is expensive, I highly recommend using the cheap internet cafe located down the road from the hotel. Walk in the direction of the metro stop......and keep walking. Eventually you will come to it. There is also a nice gelato shop on that street. Room was clean and small however I only used the room to sleep therefore it is an adequate size. Clean bathrooms, not too small. I had no issues with noise, I slept soundly. There was a safe in the room. Front reception service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Still almost faultless”
Reviews.Author: TallSeaBird
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Milton Roma, pretty much as before, possibly not as many staff about so things were a bit slower at check-in/out and in the breakfast room but not of any major concern. This time we had a slightly smaller room and the bathroom had a shower cubicle (no bath). There was a rail above the cubicle where the shower curtain had been so I guess this was one of the rooms that had been fitted with a cubicle last Autumn - on a scale of 1 to 10 I would give it about a 3. The cubicle opened at a corner with 2 half doors sliding back from the corner but when fully opened I could hardly get through the gap and it was very easy to unhinge the doors. Also the shower head wouldn't stay up, you either had to hold it in your hand or somehow try and wedge it into a position - I had thought of buying a tube of superglue but I didn't think the owners would have appreciated that. All in all I would definitely stay here again, I would just like to see a bit more design/attention paid to the showers.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious but functional - useful as a cheap base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: The_Ross_UK
Reviews.Content: I'd booked a single room, and upon arrival was allocated the smallest room I have ever stayed in - approx 2m x 3m. The room was directly under some machinery on the roof, with noise audible throughout the night. I endured two nights before asking to be moved, and was then given another single room 3 or 4 times larger and much quieter, just down the hall. The rooms could do with a bit of TLC - carpets are faded and marked, furniture and walls are scuffed, and housekeeping could be improved - the room was not vacuumed for the duration of my stay. AC was not functioning correctly, but the temperature was reasonable enough. TV in the room consisted of French and Italian language channels, CNN being the only English language option. Overall, the room was comfortable enough, and just about justified the £40/night paid. Staff are friendly and speak English well, and the breakfast buffet offered a variety of reasonable quality food, served until 10:30 (get in early for the full selection, as some items are not replenished). The hotel is situated on the edge of the Latereno area of Rome, and is a reasonable walk from St Giovanni's Basilica/Lateran Palace (5 minutes) and the Colosseum (15 minutes). The walk from Termini station (20+ minutes) is through one of the rougher areas of town, and I wouldn't recommend making this trip at night unless in a group. The hotel has a bar/restaurant, and there are a couple of grocery stores in the immediate area, along with a snack bar, pizza shop, chinese takeaway, ice cream shop and cinema. Although the hotel is directly opposite the Manzoni metro stop (line A, 2 stops south of Termini), due to engineering work there is no service on the line after 9pm, 6 days a week (Saturday until 1:30am) until April 2012. There is a replacement bus service, but it is much slower, somewhat sporadic, and generally crowded. Something to bear in mind if you're intending on spending evenings in the city centre, as there is not much evening entertainment on offer in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality room, good breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: terry919
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Three nights on our own and 2 more with a tour group prior to a extensive tour of Italy. It is conveniently located across the street from the metro. A short walk to the Colloseum & Forum. The staff was friendly, breakfast was great with many choices. The room was clean but small, as the be expected. They do shut off the A/C in the fall and it was very warm in the room. You can open the window but no screens and street noise below. The only other problem is the shower/tub combination. There is only a partial glass enclosure you must be careful not to flood the bathroom. We learned this first hand. Ask for a room facing the inside instead of the street, which we did. There is a Internet shop just down the block and a great gelato shop on the same street. It is a good hotel for travelers who are active and tired at night!! Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good place to rest at the end of the day”
Reviews.Author: travellingband_936
Reviews.Content: The metro is right across the street which makes the city accessable. Pretty much every stop on the red line has some thing to see. I used the blue line only to get to the Coloseum, which is can be reached walking fairly easily too. The hotel has a great breakfast and a safe in the room. I had to change from the first floor to the third because of street noise issues. The carpets are a bit worn, the bathroom had a shower only with a short curtain making it easy to flood the place. The staff was friendly for the most part, espesially Fredrico and Rosario. I used the bus to get to the Pantheon. The Bernini metro to get to the Trevi. The hotel rooms are small, like Europe if you're not used to that., There is and internet cafe two doors down, so you shouldn't have to pay the 4 euros at the hotel. There is also a decent restaurant across the street. All in all, I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous staff esp. Fabio and Lonette.”
Reviews.Author: michele7303
Reviews.Content: The hotel is across the street from the Metro and only 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum. The Metro is VERY easy to navigate. We recommend you use "hop on, hop off" bus one day, then use the metro to get around. Fabio (reception) and Lonette (restaurant) were wonderful, giving us kisses as we departed. We felt like we were leaving our family. Would certainly come back to the hotel. The rooms are small but comfortable. Breakfast each morning was delicious and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great personal”
Reviews.Author: CEwarrior
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the heart of old Rome Easy access to everywhere by metro or bus Great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast for the Money”
Reviews.Author: marion3034
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a two night visit. The hotel is ideally located right next to the metro, and therefore only a few minutes from all of the key tourist places. The metro is really cheap- 1 euro for a 75 minute ticket or 4 euro's for an all day ticket. Breakfast offered lots of variety and was good value for money. Staff were polite and helpful. Rooms were clean- but the TV only offered poor reception and Italian programmes- luckily I wasn't there to watch T.V! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a cheap break, with breakfast included, close to the attractions. The Colluseum was only about 10 minutes walk away. Our room did experience a lot of noise from trams and traffic- but I didn't mind- I wanted to get upm early and experience Rome.

Reviews.Title: “spoilt by one item”
Reviews.Author: redscarfox
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife ,daughter and friend stayed at this hotel for one night We were generally happy with and impressed by the hotel The staff were efficient and friendly the bedrooms ok and the buffet breakfast better than OK so what spoilt the stay? the fact that one of the obviously freshly laundered bath towels had a big lump of dried human excrement dried into it . would this stop us using this hotel again? probably not

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lenusik
Reviews.Content: I recommend this place as you can walk anywhere important in the old city from here. Best breakfast anywhere with free cappuchino/espresso drinks provided. 10 minutes walk to Termini and 10 minutes walk to Forum. We arrived on Sunday night and the restaurant was closed, however, the front desk guy recommended restaurant nearby that was terrific, not the average turist menu place. We were welcomed there as the Milton hotel guests. The hotel bar is tiny but the bartender was accomodating. The best way to get here is Leonardo express from FCO and 2 stops on LineA from Termini to Manzoni, don't get taken by the cab drivers who try to charge you more than fixed amount or put you into a shuttle at the cab fare. hotels.com had a special 15% savings for more than 2 nights stay so check this out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EFA90
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome in April with my best friend for a girl’s getaway. After considering maaany hotels, we decided to go with Hotel Milton. Finding the hotel was no problem at all, it’s right there when walking up from the Metro station. The staff was very nice and helpful. We had prepaid, and checking in was very quick and problem free. Our room was at the fourth floor, but luckily for girls with huge suitcases there is an elevator. The room was a pleasant surprise, nice space for two people, clean and lovely. The bathroom isn’t exactly enormous, but it’s really no problem at all. The location is perfect; Colosseum is within walking distance, and all the other cites is easy to reach by metro. But Rome isn’t actually that big, so you can get to a lot by just walking too. The breakfast is very nice; bread, ham, cheese, eggs, bacon, fruits and pastries. The only bad things were the coffee (which tasted like water) and that the juice wasn’t real fruit juice, but more like a non-carbonated soft drink or something. Luckily there is also tea, which is hard to mess up! The beds where very comfy! It’s a little noisy with the street right outside, but we had no problem sleeping at all. Checking out was even quicker than checking in, we just told them goodbye and left. I recommend prepaying. We got a very good deal when booking, but being student, we probably couldn’t have afforded it if we had to book directly from the hotel and pay full price. But if you can afford it, it’s definitely worth it! And it’s really not that expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a sightseeing short stay trip”
Reviews.Author: GillyB64_10
Reviews.Content: Room & bathroom both clean and nicely decorated. Although not huge in size it was more than adequate for our 3 night stay when we spent most of the day out and about. Reception staff were friendly and very helpful offering great advice and assistance when required. Breakfast was perfect for setting you up for a day's sightseeing with a large choice in the regularly replenished Buffet in pleasant surroundings. Manzoni Metro station (on the A line) was literally "across the road" which made transfer from Ciampino Airport very simple.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant - amazing breakfast - only a good value in the off-season”
Reviews.Author: JLGabroad
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, but would have been outside of our budget had we gone in the height of the tourist season. The rooms were well-appointed and the service was fine, but not the best. Wi-Fi was paying, but the breakfast was overwhelmingly wonderful. A very shot walk from the Colosseum in a decent neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “More advantages than disadvantages”
Reviews.Author: ClairyK
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really good. It's opposite a metro station. All receptionists were very helpful, friendly and their English were good. The room had a normal hotel size. Ask for a back room, in order to be quieter. The breakfast was very nice, although the hotel employees at the breakfast area weren't very polite. Also, the breakfast area should be more clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean rooms, great location and super nice front desk”
Reviews.Author: IvanaSydney2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a solo traveler very recently and was very pleased with this hotel. The location is very very good and their are excellent restaurants within 5-10 walking distance (you must go to Fassi - the first gelato shop to open in rome, a HUGE gelato shop near by). Don't believe reviews that say there is nothing nearby - did they even bother to ask anyone? The Colosseum is literally down the road. The rooms were clean and comfortable and there is a little courtyard. Staff were lovely and helpful. The breakfast was great, really more than expected. Everything from eggs, fruit, toast and choc croissants. Internet use is well, unusable, at $3 euro for 15 min. But it hardly matters since there are two internet cafes within stones throw - one literally next door. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, although as a solo traveller the price I paid was a little over budget after factoring in the taxes. Overall, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BALDWIN2
Reviews.Content: Visited with friends. Location was great next to metro. Recommend back rooms for long night sleepers as there is some noise in the morning. Breakfast great, friendly staff, rates - group- excellent will certainly revisit

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: LMBoston
Reviews.Content: The daytime front desk attendent was lovely. She was very helpful and answered all our questions with a warm and friendly attitude. The hotel itself is fine. Near the metro which made getting to the Vatican and train station very easy. Clean but nothing fancy. Very small shower even for Italian standards.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milton Roma planned my wedding”
Reviews.Author: chico5067
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good hotel to stay at In Rome , Italy stay at the Hotel Milton Roma.This is a nice hotel ( which used to be a convent in earlier days), in walking distance from the coloseum.They have a lovely continental breakfast bar and great service in the bar in the evening. I was looking for help planning a small roman wedding.I contacted the hotel to help me with the details.Anthony the hotel manager set up all the details for us including a car and photographer to take us around Rome to do wedding pictures.I later discovered it takes a year to book a church in Rome for a wedding.Anthony set all of my details up in less than three weeks! At this hotel we were absolutely treated like celebrities.This hotel has the best guest service I have ever seen anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: ice101a
Reviews.Content: According to reviews on TripAdvisor, this hotel seemed like quite the find. I was not disappointed. Hotel was very clean, staff was helpful and the price was excellent. Throw in the excellent location and this is quite a gem. I stayed 4 nights and did not regret it one bit. The hotel is located in a quiet part of Rome (removed just enough from the noise and tourist traps). There is a metro station across the street that makes exploring the city very practical. It will get you anywhere in the city in a matter of minutes. The hotel is also a short walk away from the Colosseum The only downside - I stayed in a single room and i was quite small. But, despite its size, the room was spotless and had everything a solo traveler would need. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay close to the colosseum”
Reviews.Author: viber
Reviews.Content: Room was pretty compact with everything you need for a few nights stay. A big+ for the free digitally locked safe in the closet. Breakfast was also very nice, and staff was very professional and friendly. Location was very good, since its close to the colosseum and right beside an entrance to the subway. Minus for the poorly designed shower, with no drainage hole outside the shower the whole bathroom was easily flooded. Also I'm not very fond of keycards, since I tend to forget them in the room when I leave. Overall the hotell was very good, good comfort and nice staff. Recomended!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay at the end of our trip.”
Reviews.Author: LB12345
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience while in Rome. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and the staff was very helpful and friendly, especially the staff in the bar. The metro stop was right across the street from the hotel and was within walking distance of many of the sites that we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room but the bathroom was pretty dirty”
Reviews.Author: KermitDFrog_72
Reviews.Content: From reading the reviews, it seems like the hotel has a wide range of rooms. We had a streetside room and between the ambulance sirens and car horns, it was noisy until about 2am. We were immune to it by the second day. The good: Great breakfast. Hair dryer had a 110v outlet. Staff was very polite. Close to the Metro (which is very safe and efficient). The bad: The surrounding area is not that great. The ugly: The bathroom. The shower curtain was dirty/moldy. Water from the shower got all over the floor which causes the rooms to have a musty smell. I would stay there again but, I would certainly preview the room before accepting.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel lives up to our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Anna026
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that this hotel is very good. The staff go out of their way to help you,the rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast is more than adequate. The hotel is right next to the metro,however the surrounding area is not so pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to other people looking for a reasonable priced place to stay while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Taxideftis21
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent service, very good breakfast. Big advantage its location next to the underground station (and close to Colosseum) from where you can visit most sightseeings easily. . Front rooms are noisy due to the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed...!”
Reviews.Author: Helge59
Reviews.Content: Having my wallet stolen in the Metro, the manager of the hotel went out of his way to help. With no cash, nor credit-cards, he instructed his staff to take care of me in all possible ways. He provided a free evening meal, as well as helped me to get to the airport in a taxi. This is beyond good service - it has to do with genuine care for customers. I have stayed in a lot of hotels and some of those would score higher on luxery, but this is my best hotel experience ever when it comes to care/human relations! Coming back for sure...!Besides that, excellent location, clean rooms, wonderful breakfast... What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great BReakfast - No tea coffee in room”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekG_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: the breakfast buffet was nothing short of excellent! The staff were very helpful and the location was great. The only thing we missed was tea'/coffee making facilities in our room. 1 km from the Colosseum (650m posted in the elevator, but even in a straight line is more) makes the center of Rome can be reached on foot in practice. Added convenience of the subway stop at the same hotel, as opposed to some guests, not even heard a noise meter that our room was from the entrance to it. Street on which it stands the hotel is quite busy, but if someone lives on everyday in the big city it will not be felt for this reason the inconvenience. Weak outflow from the tray causes the overflowing of the water which is a consequence of the unpleasant smell rotting carpet in the room at the bathroom door. Normal price very high, but looking at other hotels at once can say that Rome is a very expensive city when it comes to accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: VKGDelhi
Reviews.Content: Our check in was little upsetting as the person on the reception could not trace our booking, which was pre paid and booked thriugh Hotel.com. However it quickly got resolved when he spoke to some one on tele. Very pleasent room decor and the bathrooms very neat and clean. However, the only hotel where we were charged in Europe for internet ,12 Euros for 48 hours. Breakfast was complimentary, elegantly laid. We were also provide services of ironing our clothes in the lounge. Location is on the Metro station (Orangeline-just across the road)

Reviews.Title: “Amidst the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Trotter2017
Reviews.Content: Opposite to the metro station Manzoni and 10-15 minutes walk from the Collosseum is Hotel Milton Roma. Comfortable rooms and an exceptionally good breakfast with a lot of choice. We had read quite a lot of reviews about their breakfast and it lived upto our expectations. Very friendly staff. Our room had a window facing a busy road but its quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: Kenny1980
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading many reviews on trip advisor - it fit our budget and we liked that there was easy access to transportation. Positives - our room was very spacious and it was a clean and the hotel is right across the street from the subway - good as a base for exploring Rome, however, the area did not really feel safe to us. It is hard to say though whether this was just the area we were in or our overall impression of Rome in general. Everything is tagged and there are few restuarants to speak of in the area. As soon as you walk out of the hotel in the morning there are "vendors" in your face trying to sell you anything from umbrellas to water guns. The hotel staff definitely didn't go out of their way to make you feel welcome and our room was by far the nosiest room we have ever stayed in - sirens, buses and cable cars going by all night. My husband actually got up the first night to check if the window was still open.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here--dirty, unsafe”
Reviews.Author: sweetz_21_83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights with a group of 34 people and this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The rooms were dirty, our bathroom smelled like urine. We were going to ask to change rooms, but another couple we were travelling with had killed some spiders and flying insects in there room and were told the hotel was fully booked and there were no rooms available to switch to. The hotel staff did go up to the room and say they didn't see any bugs---the guests had already killed them! The street noise was incredibly loud. We were on the third and highest floor and you could hear loud honking, yelling, and traffic past midnight and it started before 5 am. I am not a light sleeper and it woke me up several times. The breakfast was ok, until some of our group had bags stolen in the dining room while serving breakfast less than 10 feet away. The only people around were our group and the staff. I'm almost positive it was an inside job, but we could not prove it. When the staff was told of the missing bags, they acted like it was not their problem and refused to call police. Some members of our group looked around and noticed an open door to the alley. The hotel said someone probably came in through the alley and took the bags. This made no sense! To get from the alley to the dining area, they would have had to pass the kitchen staff! After speaking to management, we were told this never happened before but nothing was done, the door was still open the next day. It was just too suspicious. Bottom line--do not stay here

Reviews.Title: “close to metro”
Reviews.Author: misfitintexas
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on how close it was to the metro. It was perfect! There are not too many restaurants that we found close by. When we checked in, the lady was very friendly, but when we came back down and asked something, she seemed bothered. This continued thru our entire stay of 3 days. The rooms were spacious, small bathroom. A little noisy with traffic, but slept comfortably. The only English speaking channels on the tv were the BBC and CNN world which we are finding to be true at all of our stays in Italy. No free internet but there is an internet cafe around the corner which is resonable.

Reviews.Title: “ok for short stay”
Reviews.Author: JRWilcox
Reviews.Content: As I read previously on TripAdvisor, the new annex building at Hotel Milton Roma is a little unsettling. It really isn't bad but the security on the building in lacking. I didn't mind the walk through the parking lot to get to breakfast, which by the way is pretty great for a hotel breakfast, I also didn't mind the smoke smelling hallway. I did mind the always open door to the building our room was in. Also, on Saturday evening there appeared to be some kind of night club next door. It wasn't open on Sunday or Monday but was quite loud on Saturday. If you are tired enough, you'll sleep through it, or I suppose you could join the party-ers. The room was just ok. The bed was small and the bathroom filled with water whenever we took a shower. For the price we payed and the convenience to the Metro this hotel worked for us for a few nights. The staff is friendly and helpful and you can easily get around town from here, though there is not much immediately near the hotel most everything is a short walk or metro ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Walkers-Wombourne
Reviews.Content: Good comfortable hotel conveniently located for all sights & transportation (opposite a metro stop & close to the main touritst bus stops & station). A little out of the main city ie 10 mins walk to the Trevi fountain, but this is reflected in the price (we would have paid at least half again to stay anywhere near one of the main sights in a lower rated hotel) . You do get a fair bit of noise form the road outside the hotel, as other reviews suggest, but this is a city centre & what you would expect. Good value for money & would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but avoid the annex rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bourbondunker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine - well located, clean etc however I suggest you avoid rooms 100, 200 and 300 which are in a new annex. Adjacent to these rooms are two staff rooms and we were awoken by loud talking and a strong smell of cigarette smoke on our first morning (there is a little sign in the room proclaiming the hotel to be non smoking!). We mentioned the smell of smoke and also our wonky shower to reception and on our return that evening the shower was fixed and next morning there was no smell of smoke, although the talking was louder than ever. If you are an early riser or heavy sleeper you should be fine though. Other than this the hotel was fine

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a city Trip”
Reviews.Author: Lars1975
Reviews.Content: We´ve been in Roma for 5 days for seeing all that tourist-things and the hotel was overall a good choice. Perfect Location because Bus und Metro are just steps away. And sights like Colosseum are within walking distance. The room was small but clean, with a good bed and a clean bathroom. Breakfast was standard and the staff were friendly. The only thing to complain about is the noise of the street - so you have to sleep with closed window, which wasn´t a huge problem because we had an AC, what was absolutely necessary, because Roma in August is hot!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: nacul
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a trip to Rome. Location is excellent: across the street from the metro, Line A. Although the metro coverage in Rome is not all that great, it's still easy to reach, and very easy to come back to the hotel after a long day of walk. Many things are walking distance from the hotel. A couple of wonderful churches very close, including Saint John Lateran, one of the Papal's basilica. Also walking distance from the Coliseum, and not far for the main downtown attractions. Rooms are very clean, bed is comfortable. There is no kitchen in the room, but I wasn't expecting it. Room is quite spacious. First floor is a little noisy, due to traffic noise, but not to disturb sleeping. Breakfast has lots of choices, enough to fill you through the morning. It looks like the hotel was refurbished recently, as furniture, carpets and rooms seem to be fairly new. Overall, excellent stay, very well recommended. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, but hotter than heck!”
Reviews.Author: SheaLuna
Reviews.Content: I guess I expected something a little more from a 4 star hotel.
