The beds were amazingly comfortable, the rooms clean, the night staff friendly and helpful, and the bathrooms quite nice (not to mention cleaned thoroughly every day). The breakfast was mostly quite nice. It was also in an excellent location, just across the street from a Metro station, and quiet (as long as the windows were shut). The PROBLEM was that since it was November, the hotel had shut off it's air conditioning despite the fact that it was about 75F outside (and very humid) and the rooms felt like you were in an oven (it was nearly 85F inside). We had to sleep the first night with the window open which was VERY noisy. At breakfast the bacon was undercooked and the scrambled eggs were watery. Very unappetizing when looking forward to the promised "cooked breakfast". Day staff was exceedingly unhelpful (my wallet was stolen and they refused to help me in any way). Also be forewarned, the shower heads are located in an odd position so if you're not careful, you will turn your bedroom floor into a swimming pool! All in all, the beds, overall cleanliness, the cold part of the breakfast and the night staff were definitely 4 star. The day staff, air con, and cooked breakfast were decidedly 2 star. It's possible this would be different at the height of season. At least the air con would be on. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milton Roma”
Reviews.Author: Econet78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Milton Roma in January 2010 when a lot of the UK airports were snowed in - we were lucky to get to Rome but it did make the city less busy. The hotel is about 15m away from the nearest Metro station (Manzoni) and the nearest bus and Tram stops were even closer. Transport to the rest of the city was very convenient. The hotel provided a buffet breakfast which was substantial with many types of pastries, fruit and some cold meats. Plenty to keep you going for the day to come. The room was clean and equipped with a flat screen TV and safe (which is always handy). As has been commented by other Trip advisor users the shower curtain wasn't long enough and you had to be careful indeed not to get water everywhere when it was used! The staff that we saw were very helpful but to be honest we were out most of the time! We'd use this hotel if we went back to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience--would recommend”
Reviews.Author: NikiCCEwing_NJ
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at the Hotel Milton we were greeted warmly by Rosaria AND hit with a blast of cool A/C--both were greatly appreciated! Rosaria got us a room within 20 minutes even though we were checking in hours early. Our room was clean and the bedding and pillows were comfy. We stayed 3 nights and the room proved to be very quiet. My husband and I found everything we could have wanted at their breakfast buffet--pastries, lots of fresh fruit, cereals, yogurt, breads, meats and cheeses. We didn't try the American fare, which was scrambled eggs and bacon. Although Rosaria stands out as being super friendly, all of the reception staff were pleasant and helpful when we had tourist questions. The hotel is withing walking distance to the Colosseum and Forum and immediately next to a Metro stop--which saved us so much money in cab fare. I enjoyed my stay at the Milton and hope to be back again one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JFMStuttgart_Germany
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome, where I stayed with my wife at the Hotel Milton Roma for one week. It was a wonderful experience. The hotel is very well located, to get into the Manzoni subway station, you just have to cross the road. It is a very clean and comfortable hotel, very well furnished. Rooms are very clean, breakfast very good, the staff very friendly. We definitely would love to come back to this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: flyboyUnitedStates
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome and stayed at the Hotel Milton Roma. I was traveling with a friend and we stayed in two single rooms. The rooms were spacious enough for a single. Very clean and nicely furnished. There is a fee for internet access but the connection was good. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was a great start to the day. Only two negatives, the rooms were extremely noisy at night. Our rooms were on the street side and the trolley wakes you up approximately every hour. A lot of beeping horns and police cars buzzing by. Definately ask for a room not on the street side. Also watch the shower, it is very easy to flood the bathroom! For some reason the shower is way too small and the curtain does not keep the water in. Otherwise I highly reccomend this hotel. Great location near Manzoni Station.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and staff . Room in not good condition”
Reviews.Author: LucianaLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, 10 minutes down the road from the Coliseum. Rosaria from reception is a real asset to the hotel, always willing to help. All the other members of staff were friendly too. They offer a decent buffet for breakfast, however, there is no option for room service. Condition of rooms could be improved, non smoking room had a decent size cigarette burn on desk. Very cousy bathroom with few loose fittings. I would recomend this hotel only for its location, breakfast and staff friendness.

Reviews.Title: “Bed & Breakfast boarding house”
Reviews.Author: mistertrips
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Milton Rome based on the good reviews on TripAdvsior, on the surface it is safe and clean; albeit tired, ulitarian and poorly designed. No room service, bar or restaurant so other than inclusive breakfast there are no snacks or hot drinks available. The location is excellent, staff helpful, friendly and English is fluent, however this is not what you would expect of a hotel but of a 1950's boarding house.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Delite...”
Reviews.Author: Rhea58
Reviews.Content: Bought a package tour that included 3 nights here. Wasn't originally pleased with location and I was SO WRONG. Checking in early a.m. for my single, I asked for room w/bathtub which was quickly arranged. Room itself sparse but clean w/ample toilet amenities. Bar closed for remodeling. Breakfast was a vast offering w/many pastries, fruits, juices, 3 cereals, 2 yogurts, breads, rolls, tomatos, hard-boiled eggs. The runny scrambled eggs & undercooked bacon only turn-off for a 7:30-10:30 hearty breakfast. Directly across street is the Metro A Line; next door is Tobacco store to buy metro tix. Across street is cafe; up one street on left is Fusco Risorante at Via Statilia 14 for inexpensive tasty dinner. Coliseum is a short walk away. And finally Rosario at front desk is a peach w/a welcoming warm attitude that many hotels should copy. Definitely a plus for this female solo'er.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Milton - Close to Subway and Coloseum”
Reviews.Author: liketlab
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel that I found very conveinant to all the Rome has to offer. The subway is right outside the door which was like heaven after each long day of walking and touring. The staff was nice, the breakfast was good, but the best was being able to walk outside the door pay a dollar and go anywhere you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyMoonChild
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs renovation. The main advantage of this hotel is that it is if front of the subway station. Room was quiet small. Bathroom was small. The partition for the shower was leaking. Shower was not comfortable. They chargesd us 5 Euros for half an hour slow internet at the lobby. There was nothing special about the breakfast. It was located close to the Colssuem. In Rome city Subway line A is better than the line B.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: SJayinCT
Reviews.Content: The Milton Roma provides a comfortable and convenient base when visiting Rome. Located in the eastern portion of the usual tourist area, it is across the street from a metro stop and only two stops from the termini where buses to all points can be boarded. An added plus is, when boarding a bus at the termini, you are at the initial stop and are very likely to get a seat. The basic room is clean, comfortable and well insulted from noise from adjacent rooms. As for street noise, you are in a large city. The hotel has an excellent full buffet breakfast which makes anything more than a light snack for lunch unnecessary. The hotel staff is excellent and can suggest restaurants, tours, etc. and make the required reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in overpriced Rome”
Reviews.Author: BobLind
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel at a convenient location (2 metro stations from Termini station, Manzoni metro station in front of the hotel, and 15-minute walk to the Coliseum). Rome hotels are overpriced, so even when this hotel was not cheap, it was very good in comparison to others. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, on the metro and good brekky”
Reviews.Author: LucieP1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good and clean. Reception staff were really helpful and brekky was good. It is right on the metro (manzoni) stop and takes 10 mins on metro to get into city centre. 15 min bus to Trastervere. I would recommend unless you want to be in the heart of it although we never found it a problem being out of the city and you get more for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Haddock_99
Reviews.Content: This was a decent value for Rome, especially because we were able to get one night free through an Expedia promotion. Overall we were happy, but had a few quibbles. Pros: -Location. Right across the street from the Metro. -Accommodations. Nice, but not luxurious. Cons: -Service was uneven. One staff member was super nice and helpful; the night staff member not so much. When we asked the price to make a phone call to Indonesia (our cell phone wouldn't let us call there), the clerk shrugged and told us the hotel had no list of prices by country. -Housekeeping was lackadaisical. First night we realized we had no soap, toiletries, or glasses whatsoever. Figuring this was just an oversight, we didn't say anything to the reception the next morning. Second night, again no soap or anything.. We did go down to the reception and complain - -they gave us soap. The third night we finally had our soap and glasses. It's a bit odd that the maid didn't notice on her own, though. -Breakfast. Included in our rate and good variety, but the quality is pretty low. -A bit loud. Right next to a streetcar line.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Milton Roma Our home away from home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: wiltc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Milton Roma for 4 nights in early September and loved this hotel. The hotel was perfectly located to get to all the tourist attractions by Metro....the Metro stop was directly across the street from the hotel! Our room was ample sized and clean....the ac worked just fine....one small complaint.....the half glass shower door....who ever designed that thing must have wanted to have you clean the bathroom floor while you shower because thats exactly what happens...water all over the floor every shower! needless to say we used a lot of towels in 4 days! The very tall, very beautiful Italian woman that worked the front desk was so helpful with directions and anything else we needed during our stay...wish I could remember her name...she was great! We will definately stay again at the Hotel Milton Roma when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Milton Roma for 3 nights in mid September. Pros: Close to the Metro stop. The ride takes two minutes. It is a 10-15 minute walk to Termini. Breakfast was great. It had a huge variety of the same things daily. AC works. The room I stayed in faces the courtyard and it was very quiet. The hotel faces two big streets and the tram is across the street. Single room bigger than other hotel rooms I have stayed in Rome. Cons: They made my bed but not once did they change the sheets. There was a piece of hair from the previous occupant on the sink. Yuck! The carpet needs to be updated. Internet is 8 euros per hour and it faces the reception area. Location is not in the most desirable area. I would not walk in the dark at night. Customer service is okay...not great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Clean and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: europeansummer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend about a month ago and we were both very impressed! The hotel is very conveniently located - the Metro is literally across the road. The station is called Manzoni (two stops from the main station Termini). It surprised us that you can travel anywhere on the Metro in Rome for just 1 euro. Simply purchase your tickets at the station from the machine - it's very simple! The Metro in Rome isn't too extensive but is still useful to get to all the major tourist attractions. We had booked a double room for pure convenience but when we arrived at the hotel the staff informed us they would have to put us in two separate rooms as no doubles were available. They were extremely apologetic. This didn't bother us as it meant we each had our own bathroom! The rooms are basic but very clean, comfortable and very quiet. The air conditioning was a blessing as it was extremely hot in Rome. The staff at this hotel were extremely helpful. There is one particular lady that went out of her way to point out all the attractions that we should see. They always greeted us as we came and went from the hotel and were always willing to help. In brief, Hotel Milton Roma is good value for money. If I were to go to Rome again I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate / Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mclassic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is adequate. Because I was a solo traveler, my hotel room was small. It suited my needs. The bathroom was very nice and the bed was comfortable. The hotel was having an issue with the Internet for people who want to use their own laptops. They have a PC in the lobby area that you have to pay to use. There is a very cheap Internet Cafe about two blocks past the Lazio Cafe directly across the street from the hotel. Use that if Internet is a necessity. The hotel is located just across the street from the Manzoni subway station (Red Line). It's very convenient for getting to all of Rome's major attractions. The hotel is also within moderate walking distance to the Colosseum. The area the hotel is located in is somewhat of a question. Be careful when walking around at night. And, absolutely do not walk to the hotel from the Termini station. It is much better and safer to take the train to Manzoni. The hotel's breakfast is outstanding. I wish I didn't have to leave early on the day of my checkout so that I could have had the breakfast once more. If you need a clean, comfortable and convenient place to stay, definitely consider this. Check your other options before reserving here, however.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: baoyaxigua
Reviews.Content: Hotel staffs are very helpful and provided us the tips about the city. The room is really small and the bathroom is just basic. It does not have a shower curtain so the water went eveywhere and the carpet in front of the door got wet every night.Hotel locates ou30 seconds outside of the metro station which is convinient but i could hear the train going down under the ground as i live on the ground floor, Air conditioning was noisy as well. Breakfast was really impressive. Good range of hot and cold food to choose Will recommend it as it is cheap but when make the booking in future, pls do avoid rooms on ground floor

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable hotel. Does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Beechmont45
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend Jo and I stayed at the Hotel Milton Roma for 8 nights in mid-August. The first thing we noticed about the hotel was how clean it was. The rooms and common areas were spotless. The air conditioning was very effective in the bedroom at all times and made a welcome change from the searing heat outside. The room, although a double, wasn't huge, but had all the amenities you need - except that being English, we would have liked a working English news channel on the TV. Instead we had to make do with CNN without a picture as it was impossible to tune in. So it may as well have been US radio news we were "listening" to. Apart from that, the room and bathroom were cleaned thoroughly every morning whilst we ate breakfast, so that when we came back up to our room again it was all done. As for the breakfast, we were very pleasantly surprised. I read in the previous review that the scrambled egg and the bacon were cold and congealed. This was far from true. The very friendly staff in the breakfast room and kitchen were constantly replacing any food that had been left standing, or was running low. There was plenty of choice from fruit and cereals, to cakes and pastries, cold meats, egg and bacon, to choices of bread and rolls with various cheeses. A self-serve coffee machine provided lattes, cappuccinos, espresso, etc and was hot and delicious! Basically, we were delighted with the breakfast! The location of the hotel was approx 25 metres from the nearest Metro "tube" line Manzoni which couldn't have been more convenient! Once on the Metro, you can travel to all the main sightseeing areas for a single flat rate of €1 per trip. The main station Termini is only 2 stops away. We hired a scooter from there from a great company called Treno e Scooter Rent, Rome Termini railway station - Piazza dei Cinquecento, [--] [--] for the whole time we were in Rome and the hotel kindly let us park it safely in their car park for free. So to sum up, the Hotel Milton Roma is a no-frills hotel, but well-located, spotless, comfortable, great breakfast, friendly staff (especially Rosanna Canzonieri on reception) and good value for money - we booked through Expedia. If I had to mention ONE small gripe, and it is small, that was being charged a minimum fee of €4 for 15 minutes to use the Internet in the hotel lobby when we only wanted to look up an address. If they have Broadband running anyway, I think it's a bit steep to charge a minimum of £3.50 to use the service. But as I say, that was my only gripe! Having said that, they don't charge for using the safe in the room like some hotels! If I was to visit Rome again I would definitely go back to the Milton Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel and location - a few niggles!”
Reviews.Author: Spanglor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend at the end of August. Weather was very hot and the A/C, while welcome, was ineffective. Staff generally pleasant and accommodating however the night porter at the front desk may as well be a manequin as he was simply unable to answer any questions or get anything done! Breakfast buffet comprised a good range of cold foods (lots of sweet and savoury, fruit, juices, etc ) hot food (scrambled egg and bacon) was consistently cool and congealed. We paid for double rooms for single use and got a good deal on Expedia. Would recommend the hotel as good VFM, decent location - waling distance to lots of places and metro opposite. Roma/Lazio bar across the way was a bit of a rip off but Revenge cafe further along the street was nice

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, value, & location”
Reviews.Author: cheaptravelbug
Reviews.Content: We paid $130 per night and was here for 4 nights. It was a 15 min walk to the Coliseum, and the metro station was literally right across the street from the hotel. The hotel itself is a medium size boutique hotel with a breakfast cafe and a bar. After reading the reviews I specifically requested a room facing the car port away from the street. Upon arriving in Rome, it was very easy to find and the hotel and the room had all the modern ammenities. The room is very SMALL but it does have a recently upgraded modern bathroom and a large window which had a great view. The breakfast was probably much more over the top to be considered true European. They had a full buffet from pastries, fruits, mini sandwiches, and the typical continental breakfast elements (cereal, toast, eggs, etc) Everything was fresh and my fav were the blood tomatoes with mozzarella balls drenched in olive oil. The neighborhood was very safe, we walked around the nearby blocks many times and there are tons of trattorias and pizzarias along with mini deli/markets. I would stay again for the value and location, but the room was a bit too small for me even though the bathroom was fine. Between the two of us even though it still had enough space, I got a bit claustrophobic a few times. ***TIP*** The front desk gives great restaurant tips. We were very pleased with the choice of the restaurant and of course, the food in Italy is mindblowing.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Ginners_Mate
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and obviously very recently modernised to a very good standard. Staff were 1st class - very pleasant, smartly dressed and very polite. All staff also spoke very good English. Location to metro was spot on and could not have been closer. Was not interested in bar or restaurant facilities so cannot really comment since I never even poked my head around the doors. Having said that - breakfast was provided and was a typical continental buffet style - and could not be faulted. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: bacchante1026
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milton has been my "home" in Rome 4 times. Via Emanuele Filiberto provides almost everything within reach. Among examples are the Manzoni subway entrance, a gelateria, a bar (Italian eatery), a pizza parlor, a grocery store, a dollar store where you can even purchase laundry detergent if you need to, a variety store where you can purchase tickets for the bus and subway, a shoe store with reasonable prices (just in case you wear out the shoes you brought), 2 internet cafes (because I refuse to pay the exhorbitant rate for internet use at the hotel), access to bus # 85 and #850 (which take you to the historic center with several stops within short walks from likely places tourists visit and enjoy shopping (Via del Corso, Piazza San Silvestro and vicinity). If you walk up Via Emanuele Filiberto, cross the street at the pink walled church (connected to the hotel at the back) and head down a street towards Via Principe Eugenio you'll find Fassi, an experience in gelato choices. The hotel has a great English speaking staff , is reasonably priced (don't book directly with the hotel though), and provides a huge selection for breakfast (including little ham and cheese sandwiches). Speaking of breakfast, hard-boiled eggs are overcooked, bacon is undercooked (in my opinion), espresso (capuccino, etc.) comes from a push-button machine so you can have as much as you want (though the staff made the real stuff for me when I asked). I usually book a double room ( not Room 109.) but have been happy in a single one.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room, but big buffet breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: AandN2009
Reviews.Content: The staff were pleasant and they answered our questions about the city. I was not impressed with the cleanliness of the room. The bed was basic and the sheets seemed clean but the carpets were old and had water stains. The bathroom was basic but the shower didn't have a curtain that was long enough so the water got everywhere - which is probably why the carpet in the room had water stains. My husband and I did appreciate the huge spread for breakfast. Tons of food of a good variety (hot and cold). It filled us for a good part of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Great Value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nytravelgal36
Reviews.Content: I was just in Rome 7/11/09-7/13/09 and I stayed at the Hotel Milton which I must say it was a very good choice. I was looking for a nice hotel but reasonably priced and I found it. The room was a bit small but did the job, I really was only in the room to sleep. There was also a sfe in the room.The bathroom was very nice and updated with marble and they provided soaps,shampoo and a working hairdryer. I was quiet surprised by the lovely breakfast buffet that had everything from fruit,pastries,eggs, bacon and of course coffee,tea and juices. The hotel staff was very pleasant they were very accommadating. I came back from shopping and was in hurry to catch a tour and the staff offered and took my packages up to my room for me. They were very nice. They have a computer in the hotel lobby with internet but you need to pay for the internet for a small fee. I had my labtop but the wireless internet was not working. The hotel also has bicycles for loan if you are interested in taking a stroll around town. This hotel was not in the center of anything but it was a 10minute straight walk to the Colossium. They Metro station was right across the street which I thought was great.-(Manzoni stop). The hotel provided me with a map of all the great tourist attractions to visit and they were all metro stops along the A line-(very simple to get around). Now I'm from NY so this was a piece of cake and they subway was soooo much cleaner here in Rome. I was very determined and I basically went to all the major tourist attractions in a 2 days and was very pleased with the location of this hotel. They also had the Hop on Hop off bus stop right next to the hotel if the train is not your thing. When it was time to leave the hotel was nice enough to call me a taxi to FCO airport which cost 40 euro however it is also very easy to take the train to airport as well but I a bit too much luggage and I was by myself so the taxi was easier. So I highly reccommend this hotel to those who are looking for a very nice place to stay for a good price. Steph NYC.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! This is one of the nicest hotels this side of the US...”
Reviews.Author: icemoose
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing stay here and really enjoyed it. The hotel is clean, well maintained and the room was far above my expectation. It was my first visit to the country and the receptionist Rosanna was amazing, she helped me through the maze of venues and what to do. She had such a smile on her and made me feel like we were old friends. The bar was lovely, the breakfast was lovely, and generally this was an amazing stay. Anyway cannot recommend this hotel enough and you are guaranteed a lovely stay! Marks out of 10 --> 12 !!!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are correct - Excellent Hotel, location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: BobbyPob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights, and for the price this hotel must be one of the best out there. All the good reviews about this place are spot on - good staff, rooms (except for the dodgy shower!), and breakfasts are a highlight! The receptionist moved us to a room facing the car park, which she did not have to do, but is highly recommended as the hotel is on a busy main road. The hotel is located right next to the Manzoni metro stop, two stops away from the main termini station. We walked most of the time anyway and the colloseum is only a 10 minute walk away. Would recommend this hotel and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LennyJ1
Reviews.Content: From when my new wife and I arrived at Hotel Milton we were impressed by the warm welcome from the staff. when we got to our room at the back of the hotel we were just happy to get to our room due to delayed flights. The room was very clean with fresh towels and a bottle of Champagne and roses I asked for for my Wife. In the room is a safe which I think is extremely essential on Holiday and a nice TV (even though it is true it only has one 100% english speaking channel you dont go on holiday to watch TV). The towels and bedding was changed everyday while we was out. The breakfast that was put out was excellent with a wide range of choice (my wife did say they need a leason in how to scramble eggs). All in all the staff was great and so was our stay. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel where they really care about service”
Reviews.Author: MJWKent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there from the 22nd to 26th June. The tall female receptionist who everybody refers to is an absolute godsend. She soon sorted out the taxi driver who collected us from the airport!! The place is clean, breakfasts are good. It may not look the nicest area but its OK. As others have said none of the main attractions are far away either by foot or Metro. Unfortunately the bar was closed on our visit but it didn't take much to find an alternative. Just cannot praise all the staff enough. It is a very welcome change. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beckybox101
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right beside the Manzoni metro stop which links you to all main attractions and is within walking distance of ancient Rome there are a number of restaurants in the vicinity too! The breakfast was great large selection of breads fresh fruit eggs cakes and juices self service and filling enough to go and see a day of sights in Rome! Very quite but our rooms were not on the road side rooms were quite big for european standards, clean and sheets and towels changed every day! All in all a perfect choice for staying in Rome a little outside the centre so very quiet but close enough to access all the main attractions! Also safety deposit box in the room that locks by code great addition :)

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: utt959
Reviews.Content: Located down the street from the collesium and across the street from a subway station the Milton Roma was a very good choice for me. Traveling alone I chose the cheapest room available. It was small with a twin bed but clean comfortable and the staff was professsional and helpful. I would recommend the Milton to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BILLMCC405
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in we were impressed. The beautiful young woman who checked us in, (I beleive her name was Rosaria) was frindly and outgoing, speaking very good english and even going so far as taking a map and highlighting must see areas along with the transportation required to get there. As far as the hotel, it was great. The rooms were clean and comfortable, especially the beds. The showers were alittle difficult due to 1/2 of it being inclosed in glass and the other 1/2 open, it was hard not to get the floor wet. Other than that we could not complain about anything. We read about traffic noise, but after all it is a city. The noise was minor, and beleive me, after walking all day it made no impact on sleeping. The bed was one of the most comfortable we ever slept on! The Breakfast was adiquite with pleant of choices. One tip, go early, we went late and by the time we arrived the eggs were a little cold. Plenty of fresh fruit and pastries, all very good. Overall, we coulden't be more pleased, and will definatly stay there again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: cuchiata
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at the Hotel Milton Roma and found it to be a bit of a hidden treasure. I was delighted with the cleanliness, the appointments and the exceptional breakfast offerings. Most of all I found the service and the hotel staff truly exceptional in their friendly, helpfulness and professional demeanor. The staff seemed to almost anticipate my needs and responded in an upbeat and cheerful manner. A strong recommendation from a frequent visitor to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay and perfect staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mozzys
Reviews.Content: We´ve been in Rome at the Milton Hotel and we have an extremely pleasent stay!!!! The room was very clean and new and it has all that we need, minibar, safety box, dryer, good shower....The bed was the best , very comfortable. The room was just a little bit small but just like most of it in Europe, and the window room was too high so we couldn´t see too much of the street. There was no free internet acess in the hotel. The hotel staff was the best. Always very kind and helpfull. The breakfast was in a nice sunny room and food was delicious. The Manzoni metro station is just across the street and the Colosseo is ten minutes walk from the hotel. We liked very much and we will come back again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A thoroughly enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: minniemouseRome
Reviews.Content: we found the Milton Roma an excellent choice, Our friends recommended it to us.rooms were immaculate if a little small ,Bedlinen and towels lovely,The breakfast room was light and airconditioned and the breakfast was great. staff were very courteous and helpful. the milton roma is right next to the metro which is easy to use, if you are over 65 take your passport to colosseum for free entry.its essential to take comfy walking shoes. The colosseum is within walking distance of the hotel taking about 10 minutes to get there. We would certainly go back to the Milton Roma and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay! Great service!”
Reviews.Author: miamiicpa
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel. Our room was on the first floor and the window began about 5 feet from the floor so our view was minimal not that there was much to see. The hotel is located across from a metro and a 5 min walk from a bus stop. The breakfast was good with good variety ( not a lavish buffet). I wish I would have stayed in a more scenic and central area (spanish steps) The staff was great. We had a pizza from the cafe across the street and it was fine. The cafe across the street is great for water and soda and storing in the hotel room minibar. Unlike other reviewers we did not experience any problems with noise. The rooms were a bit larger than other european hotels we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT CLEAN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: THANOS8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at milton hotel during my vacations in rome in 19 may 2009. The hotel is very clean, the staff very helpfull, the location is great (across the street there is a metro station called manzoni).Breakfast was great too and the price was fantastic 320 euros for 3 nights. I suggest this hotel to everyone but the only disadvantage is the noise from the big road in the one side of the hotel. If u ask for a room in the other side everything would be perfect

Reviews.Title: “Simply great”
Reviews.Author: cimrox
Reviews.Content: Very nice structure centrally located. All the staff is very friendly and polite. A special thank to the high, thin blond girl always smiling who has helped us at any time with a unique patience!! Thank you so much, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “metro station is across the hotel”
Reviews.Author: stregine
Reviews.Content: The Palatine Hill, Forum and Colosseum is 15 minute walk. Rosaria, the manager is very helpful and sweet. The other lady on duty is rude. Breakfast is ok, doesn't vary much each day. Room size is ok for a couple. Matress is saggym with bedmites. Shower door is just halfway, which is common in any hotels in Europe. Floor near the tub gets wet. . Need your earplugs at night as you can hear the noise of the police and ambulance sirens, which always happens each night. No room service. No restaurants. Restaurants in the neighborhood do not offer good food. Did not feel safe dining out at night in the neighborhood Few street lights down the street. No night life around the neighborhood. Pricey for its location and service. I won't go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but the location is not that great”
Reviews.Author: RuchS
Reviews.Content: The hotel stands right across the Manzoni Metro station - so if you are coming from the Railway station, take the Line A metro and get off at Manzoni. The colloseum is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel, and that's about the only historical site close to the hotel. One should stay near the Spagna or Barbariana metro stations if you want to be closer to most of historical sites or even the major shopping districts. The Hotel rooms are nice and comfortable, but they do not have a proper restaurant. One of the bigger halls is used for breakfast in the morning, but for dinner, one has to use the bar which has about 4 tables only. The staff is very helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, convenient, clean & friendly.”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinBadger
Reviews.Content: It is easy to get from FCO airport to this hotel (FCO > Leonardo Express Train > Termini Station > Metro to Marconi stop). The hotel staff was always friendly & helpful. I appreciated the fact that they spoke English. We spent three nights in a row here, then left most of our luggage in our room while we visited other cities around Italy. We returned at the end of the week to spend one more night in Rome before flying home. I was very comfortable leaving our gear in the room for several days. Everything was in its place when we returned. I forgot our outlet/power adapter at home & they gave us one to borrow for the week. They also brought our luggage to our room when Delta Airlines dropped it off the day after we arrived in Rome. As many of the reviews state, the breakfast buffet was incredible. Of the three hotels we stayed at during our vacation in Italy, my husband said that the thought that this one was the best. There was always something that we both liked (I'm a vegetarian). Our room was perfectly nice. It did face out on to the window but the street traffic didn't bother me. Those that have complained on this site about the street traffic or room size should spend more time taking in the city... that way when you get back to your room you'll fall right to sleep! Yes the shower set up was odd, but it works & wasn't a problem. Throw an extra towel on the ground & you're set. I didn't mind that there was only one English speaking TV station. Again, you're in Italy! Soak up their language, culture. It doesn't hurt anyone to be a bit disconnected from the goings on in the world for a week. As many have mentioned, the hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Coliseum (Colosseo). We walked everywhere in Rome- from the hotel to the Forum, Pantheon, Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. I'm sure you can take the Metro to various places but we're fit enough & found it easy to get around on foot. All in all I thoroughly enjoyed my time in Rome & at this hotel. I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Made by the Metro!”
Reviews.Author: rachc146
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of this hotel has to be the close proximity to the Manzoni metro station on line A, which is literally across the road. As I was travelling with an elderly relative this feature was invaluable for us to get around comfortably. We took the ATRAL bus from Ciampino for 1.20 Euros which took us to the end of the metro line. Buy your 3 day pass here and save yourself a taxi fare from the airport. San Giovanni in Laterano is a very short stroll up the road, and the Colosseum is 10 mins away (nice evening walk to see it lit up at night). Not too many places to eat around he hotel, we found it better to eat elsewhere, but the pizza place over the road is good. ATM machine close by. The room was advertised with tea & coffee facilities which were not in the room on arrival, however they were provided when I queried this. Rooms were clean and adequate if a bit small. I wasn't bothered by the noisy road but you might be if you are a light sleeper. Good variety at breakfast, although the juices were not fresh. On the whole the metro proximity made the stay; I paid E111 per night for a triple room with breakfast for 3 (with Booking.com) and I thought that was fair. Rome is wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget the earplugs”
Reviews.Author: zorrobear
Reviews.Content: I went with my daughter for a 4 night break in this hotel. It was a 'secret' hotel on Last minute.com, which means you are not told where it is until you have paid! The list of amenities described were all technically there, but as others have said, the room was very compact, mainly because this hotel used to be a convent according to the receptionist. We asked to change to a bigger room, but were told we were already in one of the biggest! What must the others be like???? Also, a very strange arrangement in the bathroom - the shower at one end of the bath with the screen at the other. Also, a heated towel rail fitted over the bath. A new modern suite & tiles though.The main drawback for us was that the 'climate control' was not working, and reception told us it is only for the summer, and just to open the window. I have come across this before in Italy, where summer does not officially start until mid June regardless of the temperature. As others have said, Rome is very noisy - sirens, cars honking, church bells, dogs, you name it and even dustbins being emptied at midnight! We had the choice between baking or being kept awake ( the noise only reduces slightly between midnight & 5am) , but fortunately had brought my earplugs with me! In fact, I slept very well, but not so my daughter. The good points - very clean, good breakfast & smack opposite the Metro. Near the Colosseum, but not much else, but the Metro got you to the main sights. The bad - the area not the greatest, (grafitti absolutely everywhere), small rooms (that seems par for the course in Rome though), and the lack of air con. HOT TIP - buy a 3 day Roma pass - it gives you unlimited Metro & bus travel (but not Airort Express) plus entrance to 2 attractions and discount on others. We didn't & lived to regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Perceived value”
Reviews.Author: Bimble672
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed in this hotel for a five night city break and paid a bed and breakfast room rate of £72pn. Had I paid considerably more than this I would now be happily complaining about a lack of English speaking TV channels and a breakfast room toaster that had just about enough power to warm the bread before depositing it in its original pallid state. After three passes through the wretched thing I think the bread turned brown out of sheer boredom. We stayed in a first floor room with the road junction just outside our window and were not even slightly bothered by the noise. As with price, expectation precedes perception. Once you accept that a) You are in a city and b) You haven't paid the earth for your room then sleep is as easy as anywhere else. A pleasant surprise was the range of refreshment choices available on a Vatican visit. You can choose one of the cafes around the square and arm yourself with a dinner party horror story of paying £4.50 for a cup of coffee ( !!! ) or go into the excellent Vatican Museum cafe, pay £1.20 and spend the other £3.30 on three Vatican apple tarts. My one issue with the entire stay was the city itself, or more correctly those governing it. The whole place is covered by graffiti. Policing theory has, very obviously, not yet got within hailing distance of Rome and Zero Tolerance has to wait for the stalwart guardians to finish their cigarettes and gently mould an errant hair back into an otherwise immaculate hairstyle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money, solid 4*”
Reviews.Author: TheHenDog
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Milton Roma for three nights in February ’09 and got a great rate on it. Here are my thoughts: Location Great location, within spitting distance of Manzoni Metro station. This is on the A line which takes you to the majority of the main sights in Rome. A leisurely 10-15 mins walk from the hotel and you’ll arrive at the Colosseum/Roman Forum/Palatine Hill/Arch of Constantine (all these 4 attractions are right next to eachother). It’s situated on a crossroads which has led some reviewers to complain about the noise. I have to say we had NO trouble getting to sleep - and after a busy day sightseeing followed by some vino in the evening, I doubt you will either! Service Staff at the hotel front desk were very helpful. More than happy to arrange cabs/give directions/hand out maps and point out where all the attractions were situated. Room Our room was small (I think all of the rooms in the Hotel are cosy) but was well proportioned and had everything we needed. The bathroom is a decent size (something that’s very important to my girlfriend!). One tiny gripe is that the only english TV channel is CNN. Room was cleaned daily to a high standard. Food Didn’t have an evening meal at the hotel but the breakfast was superb! I had enough yummy bacon and eggs to kill a cow! Great selection of fruit/cereals/cakes etc for vegetarians too. Summary Solid 4* hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Milton Roma”
Reviews.Author: cougaruk9
Reviews.Content: Very Clean and tidy hotel, good breakfast, car park facing room so no noise, single room, a little small but more than adequate, literally across the road from Manzoni Metro as mentioned. Staff very friendly and helpful at all times. The hotel although central isn't actually in the centre, some prefer things like that, others may find they are a little further out than is ideal, although its only a 20-25 minute walk to the centre of old Rome. Apart from most of the other comments the hotel also offers complimentary push bikes for all its guests ... this for me was an unexpected added bonus which I'd not known beforehand although your not provided with any helmets or the like, its no different to cycling in any other major city and resulted in me seeing masses more in the 4 days than I'd have expected. No one seemed to have made use of the bikes as whenever I returned all the other bikes where in place and both Saturday and Sunday where perfect sunshine cycling conditions ... both buses and the underground metro seem frequent so you takes your choice I guess. From my experience the Navonna Piazza and Campo De Fioro were the areas that had that chill out factor where you'd happily spend the evening eating, drinking and people watching, possibly taking in a nightclub if that's your choice. Overall happy with my stay, wished I'd have been closer to the centre but the push bike more than made up for inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mel_fuzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milton Roma for a short trip to Rome. Overall I really liked this hotel. We got a great rate on Expedia. The hotel is in a quiet area but right next to the metro station so its very easy to get around. Our room was a nice size and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. The tv only had one english channel (CNN) which was not really a huge deal but it would have been nice to have a few more channels. The shower took a bit of getting used to. The main issue was that if the curtain wasn't pulled across perfectly water splashed out into the room. It was a little bit of a pain. On the last night the shower broke so we mentioned it to reception on our way out for dinner. The receptionist mentioned the repairman had already gone for the day but they would see what they could do. When we arrived back everything was fixed so we were very impressed. A lot of reviews mention the traffic noise. Our room faced the road and there was noise. It did not bother me at night but my husband did struggle to get a good nights sleep because of the traffic. Finally the breakfast is worth mentioning. Everything was fresh and very enjoyable. There was a nice choice of hot and cold food.

Reviews.Title: “Near collosseum but not much else, Not 4*”
Reviews.Author: topcat07Uk
Reviews.Content: PROs: -Good breakfast -Friendly staff- gave good tourist advice -Metro across the road -can leave your bags if you have time before you go to airport CONs: -I was a bit dissapointed with the whole look of the hotel. My first thought was it was like a corner shop, with sliding doors. Nothing special - situated on a busy road. Noisy even for me. -The room window was higher than my height -The colloseum is 10/15 mins away, but even then its not a central location. So more walking! - the area around the back of the hotel is a bit rough. -Not 4* While I really enjoyed my time in Rome, I wouldn't return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: jene
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for two basic reasons. Convenience and security. As many readers have mentioned it is directly accross from the metro station. Just as importantly, it is an A-line which is the far cleaner (safer feeling) line that connects to most major sites. I also felt we were in a very safe location. While I've heard Rome is not a dangerous city, we did wander into several unsavory areas that made me thankful for the neighborhood we were staying. Many view it as a downside that the location isn't geared toward tourists, but we found it nice to be away from the street thieves and pick-pockets of more touristy areas. The hotel offered a nice breakfast that was included in our rate. The hotel staff was fine, no major praise or complaint. We had a very loud street facing room and I found it very difficult to sleep. My husband had no problem. Overall I would say the hotel is a good value and worked well for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Hamo4lyfe
Reviews.Content: Had a late check in with no issues. Room was small but facing the carpark (away from the main roads) which was a bonus. If booking, ask for a room by the carpark. That way, you won't have to deal with the traffic noises. Staff were excellent, friendly and helpful. Requests for extra blankets and linen changes were done with no hassle. I also recommend the hotel's breakfast, it was a great spread. Location is fantastic, the hotel is located across from Manzoni station (line A), with bus and tram services available also. Unfortunately, I got the flu during my last 2 days and luckily there was a pharmacy (Farmacia) two doors down. Also an internet and phone place next door to that - I was ecstatic. With all the internet prices that I encountered in various other countries, it was a relief to have one close by and at a fraction of the cost of what the hotel was charging. Hotel charges 4 euro for 15mins, internet place - 2 euro per hour. Restaurants, Fruiteria (fruit shops) and Tabacchi (buy metros cards from) are all located within walking distance. Would I stay here again? Definitely! The location is convenient and the staff made my stay pleasant. Mangaia Tofilau - Melbourne, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect but I won't be staying again”
Reviews.Author: Dar27
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a 4 night stay in the Milton Roma with my girlfriend and we were glad to get back. For me, a hotel needs to provide just two things: 1: A clean room where I can get a nights sleep 2: Somewhere that I can safely store my belongings while I'm am out. When I travel to a city, especially one such as Rome, I don't expect to be in my hotel room for a great length of time, as there is so much to see and do. After the long days of walking around, sightseeing, in the city, all we really wanted to do was go back to the hotel and go asleep and get up, refreshed, the next morning and head off early for another day of wandering around. Like most/all hotels, there are pro's and con's with them and the Milton Roma is no different. Its then up to you to decide whether the pro's outweigh the cons or the other way around. PRO'S: Location: From either airport, you can make your way to Roma Termini Station, jump on the Line A Metro and get off at the Manzoni station. The hotel is directly across the road. Very easy. Five minutes walk down the road from the hotel is the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. For almost anything else, the Metro across the road can be used and there's a regular bus service and an over ground tram system that run by the hotel also. I didn't use the bus or tram but I'm sure they can ferry you to areas that the Line A Metro doesn't. All in all, very easy to get around the city beginning from the hotel front door. Rooms : Small but clean. TV with one English language channel (CNN). A safe, minibar and air conditioning. No complaints about the room. Hotel Staff: Very nice, friendly and helpful. While this would be expected in any hotel that you stay in, it's not always the case but no complaints here. CON'S: No hotel restaurant - I didn't mind this but others may not like the idea of a hotel not having an in-house restaurant. No room service - I must admit, I like hotels with room service, especially when you get back after a long day and just want to something quick and easy to eat, like a freshly made sandwich. Having said that, I didn't mind this too much either and there is a snack bar across the road that opens late enough. Noise from the traffic outside - This is the sole reason that I will not return to this hotel. We were on the 3rd floor, facing out to a busy junction and the noise from the traffic was incredibly loud - ALL NIGHT! The beeping car horns, police and ambulance sirens and the screeching trams was relentless. It was like the window was wide open. I am not a light sleeper but found it impossible to get a full nights sleep without waking up 8 or 9 times with the sound a tram going by. It sounded like an earthquake at times. The police and ambulance, complete with wailing sirens, were whizzing by every 7 or 8 minutes, which I was very surprised by as the Rome that I saw was very peaceful and non threatening. Its a shame that this was the case as I would have no problem in recommending this hotel to anyone who was travelling to Rome for a sightseeing trip. The location is excellent so if you are already booked in for a stay, bring earplugs, unless you're a very very heavy sleeper. There are a number of rooms facing into the courtyard away from the noisy junction so maybe that's the answer to the problem I encountered. However, I won't be going back to see if it does resolve the noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Great alue Hotel”
Reviews.Author: burford8
Reviews.Content: My Wife and i have just returned from a four day Roma city break we booked this Hotel last minute purely on price and were totally delighted with our choice on arrival. The Hotel is fifty yards from the Metro Station from which you can access all the main tourist places with ease the Hotel is very well equipped and clean the staff are simply superb breakfast is fabulous you will be spoiled for choice bacon and eggs, continental all you could wish for The one down side were the bar meals very expensive for what you got not well presented better give them a miss Overall a very good midpriced Hotel a bit noisy at night but then again it is on a main junction and you cant have everything will certainly stay there again when we next visit Roma

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bikemonkey
Reviews.Content: We picked the Milton Hotel as most of the other hotels in our price range looked chintzy and dated. The hotel itself was quite pleasant - the room was a little smaller than we're used to but not bad compared to other city centre hotels I've seen elsewhere in the world. The location was quite good - although not central, it's within walking distance of the Colosseum and (if you're relatively fit) the centre of Rome. We managed the walk a couple of times, but the Metro is so cheap (1 Euro for 75mins of travel) and convenient that it seemed to make more sense. The ticketing system is an absolute breeze to use. I had read the reviews before travelling that said the hotel was quite noisy and expected this to be people just over-reacting. We were on the first floor at the front of the hotel and I must admit, it was rather loud at night. My girlfriend got up a couple of times to check whether we'd left the window open! I'm sure if we'd been sufficiently bothered, we could have asked for a different room but we were that tired from sightseeing that we soon fell asleep anyway. The staff were exemplary, and couldn't have been more helpful. On check-in we were given a map of Rome and the lady on reception (I don't recall her name) went through which metro stops were best for which sites and gave us a leaflet of tours which could be booked through the hotel. We went on the Rome by night tour. We were picked up from the door and dropped back again later. It was nice to see all the attractions at night as some of them look twice as good. The square around the Pantheon is great for evening meals. The Pantheon itself is illuminated after dark and the square comes alive with street performers. With your back to the Pantheon, the best restaurants are opposite you and to the right. The restaurant on the left was over-priced, served the worst food we had in Rome and tried to get us to pay the 15% service charge twice!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peahead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Milton for my sister's 30th birthday in October and had a really nice stay. The hotel staff were very friendly, the rooms were clean and modern (if a little small) and the breakfast was excellent. I'd definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emilysj
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner visited rome (our second trip to rome-in which we previously stayed in welcome home residences, which I had booked again through expedia, however a week before expedia emailed advising hotel was closing down so expedia rearraned alternative accomodation for us at the hotel milton roma) stayed at Hotel Milton Roma 14-17 October 2008. The hotel was easy to find, we caught the terravision coach from Ciampino Airport which takes you straight to Stazione Termini (Main station in rome). From here we caught the Metro to Manzoni station which is directly outside the hotel. The Metro was 1 Euro for a ticket valid for 75 minutes or you can buy a 24 hour ticket for 4 Euros, either way its cheaper & quicker than a taxi. Our flight was delayed by an hour so we didnt arrive at the hotel until about 730pm. We were greeted at the front desk & given our room key along with a map of Rome. Breakfast which was complimentry is from 7am until 11am & consists of toast, crossaints either plan or with Jam or Chocolate, Sweet pastries, and one morning they even had pizza!! Also yogurts, cereal, bacon, cheese & ham rolls. We filled up on food at breakfast to last us for the day & we took some crossiants with us from breakfast in case we got hungry! The room was nice (two single beds pushed together-which is the norm in european countries) There was an LCD TV with CNN & MTV other channels were Italian. They also have tea & coffee making faciilites in the room, howvever there was no milk but when we asked at reception they got us a jug of milk, but there is a supermarket down the road. The room was on a busy main road, which was quite noisy at night as there is about 6 roads leading past the hotel & quite alot of police & ambulances passing with their sirens on. The walls were quite thin as we could here the shower running & the toilet bein flushed in the rooms next door, although we didnt hear anyone talking or the tv. The room overall though was nice and the hotel is completely no smoking. The location of the hotel is good as the metro is directly outdside which closes at 10pm each night. Its cheap & quick & the best way to get around the city, as we caught the metro to the vatican & the fontana di trevi. We visited the sistine chapel also which is a must see, as well as the pantheon & colloseum. I would recommend a restaurant we ate at on our last night called Ristorante Roma Rosae which is on via di pietra, 88, about half way between the fontana di trevi & pantheon off the main road via del corso. Overall the hotel is good in a good location with a good breakfast, only down fall was that it was a bit noisy if you have a room on the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: KK-White
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Milton Roma for 10 days this past August, and had a great stay there. Good location and very easy to get around. 10 min to Colosseum, and Manzoni metrostation just across the street, as well as busses going to and from all day.... I had a room in the back so the traffic didnt bother me at all :o) Very good breakfast, and excellent staff!!! Looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: 3travelers_frm_sd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days. Staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Rosaria who was a real charm. Enjoyed the breakfasts and convenient location just across the street from the Mazone metro station which gives you excellent access to the rest of the city. Also, the Colosseum is just a short 15 minute walk away. Room was really clean and nice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: jlaw1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in a room for 3 people upon our arrival in Rome at the beginning of our 2 weeks trip. Stayed 3 nights in August 2008. Booked hotel via Expedia and paid about $240 canadian per night inclusive of breakfast. The hotel is conveniently located (RIGHT across a subway station that is 2 stops away from Termini station). No need to take a cab to the hotel as this will run you almost 30 euro taxi ride for a 5 minute distance. It takes about 15 to 20 minutes to walk to Coliseum. The breakfast was one of the best "free" breakfast during our trip. The rooms are very clean. Good size room. New flatscreen TV. Hotel rents bikes. Staff is helpful (especially the lady that works later shift). Internet is available but you have to pay. The elevator was not working one of the day that we were there but it did not affect us. The only bad thing to say about this hotel is that the rooms facing the street are a bit noisy. Thats all. It was a good choice. DO NOT eat at the restaurant right across the Hotel even if you are starving! It was the worst restaurant of our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BoLucky
Reviews.Content: We were a party of seven spending 6 nights at the Milton. From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel welcomed and a part of their family. The rooms were quite comfortable and well appointed. We would recommend obtaining rooms on the non-street side but the city engineers will not be taking down trees all the time. The morning continental breakfast was quite good with a wide variety of choices. We would recommend for the Hotel 'bar" to open earlier as our cocktail hour habits begin earlier. Somewhere near 4 or 5PM rather than 7PM. We traveled at the hieght of an imbalanced exchange between the USD and the EURO but the price for our stay was quite comfortable The location of Hotel Milton is very convenient to almost all transportation needs and within a fairly comfortable walk to the Colliseum and ancient Roma. In making our reservations, the staff was very responsive to every email sent. We absolutely fell in love with everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cjm2279
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. Nice clean rooms, and decent breakfast. Ideal location, only a few minutes walk to the Coliseum. Located directly oppisite the train station, really easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Backtowork
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days in Rome in this Hotel. Very clean. Good breakfast buffet. Perfect location. Just opposite the Manzoni metro stop. Helpful staff at the reception. Extra cool waiters. Believe me just watch the waiters' actions while you are having your breakfast. So Italian…

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a courtyard room.”
Reviews.Author: darnley
Reviews.Content: Just had four nights in Rome staying at this hotel. located 20-25 minutes walking distance from the central train station Termini or 5 minutes on Metro to station which is right opposite hotel. Very convenient for seeing sights (1 euro per trip) 15 min. walk to Colleseum. Hotel was apparently full whilst we were staying but checking in process was quite swift and painless by friendly polite staff. Unfortunately the rooms facing the courtyard were taken but was assured that one would be available for remaining three nights. Room allocated faced the dreaded intersection which was indeed a little noisey with early morning traffic but reading previous reviews we came prepared with ear plugs. Room itself was a touch small for 4star rating but were moved to larger quieter room next day. Air conditioning was very good and needed as day temp. was very high. Breakfast was very good indeed with choice of cereal ,juices, fruit, yogurt, bread rolls, cooked meats ,cheeses, jams, toast , bacon and eggs with tea and coffee plentiful. Unfortunately like most hotels the drink prices were extortionate. May I suggest removing hotel drinks contents from the minibar, go to supermarket 10 min. walk and purchace beers, wines and water and keep them in minibar at a fraction of price.eg. bottle beers less than 2 euro. Whilst your at supermarket 2 min on same street is the oldest icecream place in Rome, its called Fassi's and is just fantastic to say the least. Overall this hotel was very clean and fresh looking with friendly staff and a good breakfast facility

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TLCKent
Reviews.Content: Hotel was comfortable, room was a little small but functional. Staff were friendly. Was well priced for such a good location. Hotel is about 10 mins walk from Colloseum and right across from the metro, we had and easy trip by train/metro from the airport. Not many places to eat around the hotel but as it's an easy walk to the colloseum it wasn't a problem apart from the fact that most of the restaurants were very touristy. Found a great fish restaurant on our first night, We didn't realise until we had been seated and got drinks, unfortunately, I don't eat fish, but they did me a basic pasta dish. overall the hotel was clean, friendly ad the breakfast was fine. Tip: at breakfast they have an auto coffee maker, if you like better coffee ask the waitress for one and they will go and make for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nando09
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, quiet and provides a good breakfast. Loved the shower room. Air conditioned, fridge tv. It's convenient for trains (literally over the road from Manzoni train station) but a little bit too far to walk in and out of the central attractions although it is about a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum. We generally walked in and then picked up one of the many buses that pass the colosseum and walked home from there. Personally I prefer the Termini area (north of the station) to this area for convenience but coming home to a nice hotel at the end of the day more than made up for that. Internet too expensive but there is a little internet cafe just around the corner that is ridiculously cheap but closes of an evening. If you get a chance, walk down to San Giovanni in Laterano which is about 5 minutes downhill to see an absolutely wonderful church, really is breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Merav_A
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Milton for a whole week and had a great time! The room was spotless, the air-condition worked well, breakfast was wonderful and the staff was helpful. A metro and two bus and tram lines located right across the street connected us to wherever we needed to go. Some major attractions are a walking distance away. Good worth for money! Disadvantages: There is not much to do in the area at night. The nearby road could get noisy at night. Nevertheless – a great deal

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelH43
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean, spacious and conveniently located. We stayed for 4 nights and were able to get to all the major sites in town easily, as the ancient center is a 10 minute walk, and the subway is right across the street for access to sites further away. Breakfast was good and plentiful. The hotel meets most "average" American standards.

Reviews.Title: “Rome with a view”
Reviews.Author: helix77
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome and we did choose this hotel after reading a lot rewievs on tripadvisor. The hotel is located 1o minutes walk from Colosseo. You have the subway station right outside the hotel door, just across the street. The red line, Manzoni station. The red line is also an important line cause with this line you can get to the most of the sightings. We arrived at Fiumicino and took the Leonardo Express to Termini. From Termini we took the red line, two stations. You need to walk a bit to get to right platform at Termini and with big bags it can get a bit heavy. A ticket and the subway costs 1 euro. The hotel is at a crossing with trams, buses and cars. So if you’re a light sleeper ask for a room away from the road. The rooms 320, 321 and 322 is the onces you need to stay away from. It’s right at crossing and you will get a lot of noice. The hotel staff were kind and informed us about two trips with buses. But we also got a map over Rome were they informed us to get the red line as good way to see all things. Breakfirst was ok, were planning on eating as much as we cold before we got out on town. The had a buffet with, fresh fruits, eggs, ham, cakes and a couple of more things. Hotel has internet but it was expensive, it costed 4 euro for 15 minutes. I recommend to use the internetplace located if you go left out from the second door(not the door that face that subway) at the hotel. It is only about 20 meter from the hotel and they have internet, fax, telephone service. On you first visit you need to bring your passport. You will get a username and password that will last the hole time you are in Rome. If you go there a second time you don’t need to bring a passport. Just walk inside and login, you pay when you’re done. The price is better. 0,50 euro for 15 minutes, 1 euro for 30 minutes. The best Ice cream bar is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel, it's located at Via Principe Eugenio 65. It dosen't have a clear sign outside so you can miss it. There is also a supermarket at that road. The best thing is the location and the fact that is so close to the subway, Also across the street is Best Western President hotel and so if you want an even shorter way to the subway you should choose them.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: clarkkr79
Reviews.Content: Overall a decent experience with a slight hitch... We had booked a 3 night stay here about 8 weeks in advance and reconfirmed about 2 weeks in advance.. All was fine. When the two of us showed up we were told there was a computer problem and they did not have a room for us for the night, but they would have one available for the last 2 nights. After 3 flights and traveling all day from the western US, I was a little frustrated to say the least, BUT they had told me they already had a room for us in a hotel 5-10 minutes away on Via Cavour. They said it was a comparable room and we took it.. They called a cab for us, paid the cab fair, and told us in the morning if we wanted to leave our luggage at this new hotel they would gladly go and pick it up and bring it back to the Milton for us. We actually brought our luggage back on the metro the next morning around 9 AM and they had a room ready for us within 5 minutes, and asked us for a metro or taxi receipt so they could reimburse us the cost of getting back to the hotel. Now would they have been this outgoing if we only had a 1 night reservation? Can't tell. But they were very nice, and I genuinely believe them it was an honest mistake, and with the location to the metro I would certainly recommend this property to anyone looking for a nice, clean, relatively inexpensive hotel in rome

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like an American Hotel (FINALLY)”
Reviews.Author: Tannerrific
Reviews.Content: Was a nice clean room. Felt like it was up to American travelling expectations. Modern, clean, newish (everywhere else we stayed was super old which is not common here in the states). The staff were okay, not the friendliest or the least friendly, decent. Loved the location (the metro is across the street! PERFECT for getting around). There aren't a lot of places to eat nearby but the little cafe across the street has some really awesome employees that speak fabulous english, (and one of them makes a killer ham, cheese, and mayo sandwhich).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ConyPard
Reviews.Content: For the price, you could not beat this place. Close to the Metro and walking distance to Colesseum and other sites. Rooms are smallish (by North American standards) but, they were clean and quiet. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Colosseum and Metro”
Reviews.Author: amauldin
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at the Hotel Milton Roma. The staff was very helpful, the breakfast (buffet) was good, and the location is great if you plan on using the Metro. The station is just across the street for getting on the A line. The Colosseum and Forum are just a half-mile walk straght down the street. Takes less than 10 minutes to walk there. The immediate neighborhood is pretty quiet, and if you get a room overlooking the courtyard, you probably won't hear a thing all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Easy to reach & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A13J
Reviews.Content: The hotel Milton Roma was a great location, Rome is easily walkable and the metro -almost outside the hotel door- offers easy mobility and its cheap a single journy at 1 euro. The hotel offers smart, clean rooms friendly English speaking staff and good local tourist advice on arrival with a free map. The varied and excellent breakfast in the morning served 7-11 gives a great start to the day. The small bar area offer snacks and limit meal optionsn but plenty of places to eat are around every corner. The hotel is on a busy junction but not really a problem as Rome is a busy city and not for those looking for a peaceful place to visit. The hotels own website offers good pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, above its class”
Reviews.Author: fussytraveler27
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasure to stay at. From the airport to hotel was pleasant, train to Termini station then 2 stops on the metro to Manzoni. Manzoni station is ont he door step of this hotel. but dont worry about the noise, we didnt here a thing. Check-in was very smooth, service was the Italian standard, abit lower than australian standards. The guests were mainly business and retirees who wanted a quiet and classy stay, so was a welcoming change for us two euro trip travelers. Rooms are lovely, best bed I slept in during whole 6 week euro trip, an actual king size bed, lovely pillows and specky LCD TV, tea and coffe making facilities and bar fridge. Bathroom was well equiped, however shower isnt well designed, we seemed to flood the bathroom everytime we used it. Heated towel racks are a nice touch. The breakfast was fanstastic a full buffet with cerals, fresh fruit, bacon and eggs, continetal section and the best desert table ever, thye love their nutella, and so did I. Our flight was leaving at 8pm however a late checkout allowed only until 1pm, they were happy hold our bags until 6pm though. Overall the best hotel we stayed at while on out 6 week trip. Booked on cheaperthanhotels.co.uk and paid 560 euros for 5 nights over a weekend

Reviews.Title: “Best-in-class hotel for Rome”
Reviews.Author: vagabiztravlr
Reviews.Content: This is a Best-in-class hotel. Very clean and secure. Great central location, right by metro/trams/bus. Wonderful breakfast included. Only complaint is lack of Internet in the room. Nice people. Great Hotel for a World-Class city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: mindfood
Reviews.Content: Saw many great reviews on this place and wasn't disappointed. Got a great rate through Ryanair and it turned out to be excellent value. Beautiful rooms, lovely staff, great location. Only downside was that while our corner room had double glazed windows, the actual window frames themselves weren't that well insulated. The trams can be a bit noisy at night but not enough to detract from what was a great stay at this hotel. For the noise sensitive there are plenty of rooms facing into the rear courtyard which I'm sure would be quiet

Reviews.Title: “Great for Price”
Reviews.Author: MarkNewham
Reviews.Content: For the money this is a very good hotel. During our trip to Rome we checked out a lot of other hotels in the city as we are coming back in May to marry here and this was far superior to a lot of the four star hotels in the city. We found many of the other hotels very dated and fusty however this hotel is much more upto date. The down sides were that the room was small (however this is to be expected in Rome) it was also quite noisy as it was road facing (again normal for Rome) and the window was high up in the room so not ideal. The room was as I say clean and modern and the breakfast buffet acceptable. I would go back here low season but not high season as the prices go up too much. The little coffee shop (and it is little) straight opposite has great cheap pasta / pizza and sarnies and was a good starting or ending place. Rome like most cities is expensive for hotel rooms and off peak this was extremely well priced howeve rliek I say we would not go back during peak season as it is too expensive for what you get. The only hotel we saw which beat this by a long long way was the Hotel S Anselmo, but then it is a lot more a night!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for trip to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Fiffle
Reviews.Content: After trawling through the vast lists of accommodation in Rome we found this hotel and elected to stay here. It was incredibly easy to find - catch a bus to Anagnina where you catch the Metro, from here you go directly to Manzoni, walk up the steps and there is the Milton! The rooms were very clean. Breakfast consisted of fruit, pastries, breads, cheese, cereal, coffee and 'bacon and eggs' (not really the kind we would eat - the bacon was pure fat and the eggs were very sloppy)! This aside, there was plenty to fill you and we strongly recommend the cakes! The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum so is not as central as many other hotels but the fact that it was directly next to the Metro meant that we could reach anywhere in Rome in under 20 mins. The road was a little noisy but we managed to sleep through it (possibly assisted by the lovely Chianti at dinner)! We had a great stay here and would recommend it as a good base.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: alichan
