Reviews.Content: There are a lot of things I can say about this hotel and I don’t even know where to start.Me and my friend has spent a lot of time researching on a hotel in Rome and we finally decided on the Milton Hotel as it was within our budget and the metro was outside the hotel.Off course, we did read loads of reviews on the hotel and we also found the same problems other people have wrote.The only thing they got wrong with our booking was we asked for a quiet room but we were put facing directly in front of the main road. A few other people has written about the road noise, but I didn’t realised it was that noisy and it continued all night, even at 4am. I felt that I never slept all on my first night there. Therefore we asked for a room change first thing the following morning. The reception guy did his best and found only one other room he can offer us at the back of the hotel. We went to see the room first and then agreed to move. It was a lot smaller and it was a double instead of a twin, but we didn’t mind because we just wanted a good night sleep. Quiet it was, but there was another problem! The shower! In our 1st room, the shower was inside the bath, but the glass screen wasn’t long enough so you will get the floor slightly wet. But in our 2nd room, the shower was on the floor, so there was nothing stopping the water from getting everywhere inside the room, including around the toilet and the sink and it also leaked out onto the carpet. We had to use loads of towels to get rid of all the water.Apart from all that, the hotel was very clean and all the staff was really friendly. Breakfast was lovely; I don’t understand why people moaned about the size of the breakfast room where there is more then 20 tables there. The section of food was brilliant too, cereal, fruits, cakes, bread and hot food, really fresh and yummy. I would recommend Hotel Milton as it is very good for the price you pay. Apart from the noise level (its noisy everywhere in Rome as nearly all the hotels are on busy roadsides,) it’s a brilliant experience after all as Rome is a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apart from small issue”
Reviews.Author: baddiel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite good by rome standards. The rooms are fairly small but clean and the neighbourhood is quietish and right next to the metro stop. The issue we had is for the first night they squeezed us into a single room instead of the double we had booked. Given that we didnt have a choice we accepted. We didnt mind too much although we felt a bottle of wine or choclates or a small gesture would have been appreciated given the inconvenience caused.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashmorayw
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Our room was clean and spacious. It was noisy as it overlooked the main road but Rome is not the place to go if you are looking for peace and quiet! It was an easy 10 minute walk to the Colisseum and we also used the Metro which was directly across the street from the hotel. There is a limited and expensive bar service in the hotel but there are a couple of good bars across the street which are much cheaper. The staff were friendly. The internet in the hotel is very expensive but there are lots of internet cafes in Rome which are cheaper. To sum up a great value hotel for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsBBath
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon based on reviews on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed. We had a room at the front of the hotel and did not find the noise a problem - much quieter than front rooms in London hotels. The shower was not a problem for us either as we had a bath with a shower screen, however another couple who just had a shower cubicle said they had problems with the bathroom flooding. Agree with the previous review though, the shower can go from chilly to boiling and back again without any input from you. The breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of items (not sure about the previous review that there was not much choice - there was something for everyone): Cereal, fruit (fresh and tinned), yoghurt, cheese and meat, tomato, scrambled eggs, bacon, bread, rolls and toast and a wide selection of cakes and pastries, coffee was also fine. We walked to all areas of Rome from the hotel quite comfortably and it is ideally situated for the colosseum and Roman forum. A good bus service from outside the hotel was well used by some guests. Staff were very friendly and helpful, with a couple of minor exceptions (breakfast cleared 20 mins early on first day and bar closed at 10.55 because the barmaid had done her 5 hours). We would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OUR ROOM HAD BEEN DOUBLE BOOKED”
Reviews.Author: Micmac01
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with a problem - its internet booking system. Despite having received e.mail confirmation of our 5-day booking we were told on arrival that there was no room available. The receptionist guy suggested he was having trouble with the booking part of the hotel website! But he hadn't thought to contact us in advance. Along with a Canadian couple who were having the same problem we were shipped out to a 3* hotel off the Via Cilicia which is a one long trek into the city. Not a good start to a celebration for a special birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Milton Roma - lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: RuthSheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: We found the Milton Roma to be a really nice, convenient place to stay. It was spotlessly clean and our double room was a decent size, with a great wall-mounted flat screen TV. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and had no problem in letting us have our room an hour and a half before check-in. Breakfast was great, a really good selection of cereal, fruit, youghurt, meat, cheeses, pastries, scrambled eggs and bacon, and served until 11 am. Manzoni metro station was still closed when we went (and to be honest, it doesn't look as if it was in any state to open at any point in the near future!) so the nearest Tube was Vitor Emmanuele, about an 8-minute walk away. When we arrived we actually walked from Termini, which took about 20-25 minutes with our wheelie suitcases, as we couldn't be bothered with the faff of getting on the Metro for only one stop. The Milton is also only about 10 minutes walk from the Colusseum. The only few negative points about our stay were: 1. The room did get quite a lot of noise from the street, particularly on Saturday night when everyone was out - but we took earplugs so it wasn't really a problem. 2. One of the staff tried to sell us their "private shuttle" to get back to the airport on Monday morning (for 55 euros, 25 euros more than a normal taxi) but when we said we wanted a normal taxi he became a bit offhand. 3. The shower, as mentioned in other reviews - curtain doesn't go all the way round the shower tray so you end up with a lake on the bathroom floor! Otherwise this was a really good place to stay, and would reccommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - a young couple review”
Reviews.Author: Amsyyy
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from 3 nights in Rome and would summarise the hotel as follows: Positives: Clean Hotel - 4 star standard by appearance Okay Location - 10 mins from colleaseam but if i were to book again I would try to get a hotel near Piazza Nivarro as its central to everything Metro - the one opposite the hotel is closed but next nearest is only 5 minutes away (Victoria) Flat screen tv - although only english channel is CNN but there's so much to do in Rome your only likely to watch tv late at night Breakfast - Continental breakfast was Okay Staff on front desk were helpful in terms of maps, where to go and eat etc Metro closes at 9pm so we walked back past the colleaseam each evening when it was lit up - very romantic! Negatives: Shower wasnt great - water kept going from hot to cold Room service charge 5 euros Breakfast - no fresh orange juice, coffee was sub standard and it felt as though the staff wanted you to clear off as soon as possible Summary A good hotel by rome standards

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Antxl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this hotel which is really close to the nearest train station currently in operation, we were delighted with the lovely reception area. We booked a triple room but due to some mix up they gave us 3 single rooms for no extra charge which was great. The delightful reception staff also provided us with a map indicating key sights and info on how to get to them. The rooms are great, with the only slight problem being the shower curtain issue mentioned before in previous reports. Breakfast is wonderful with a great selection, and the scrambled eggs are amazing! All in all a great hotel to stay in with great travel links to all over the city with just a few niggling problems like the shower curtain thing. Would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nz7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The room was modern and very clean!! Bathroom was also modern and more than adequate. The breakfast was average I felt. Not as much selection as I had hoped but seems to be the standard for Rome hotels. Location of the hotel was great. It's not in the central area but it was fine as you can either take the bus or walk 5 mins to the nearest Metro. The closest metro station Manzoni was still closed when we went. The colosseum was also within a walkable distance (10-15mins). Just a word of warning - we landed at Ciampino airport and you can pay 30 euros max to take the taxi to this hotel. However, we were unlucky in that we had a taxi driver who didn't know where the hotel was and upon arrival to the hotel, he tried to charge us more than the 30 euros. We stood our ground and refused to pay anything more than 30 euros and he eventually left. So don't let the taxi drivers tell you otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AnneandRich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for our first wedding anniversary and had a fantastic time. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly and helpful and the facilities good. Several people have made comments about the road noise - we stayed in a room at the front of the hotel (i.e. facing the road) and although you could hear cars etc we didn't find it a problem and had no problems sleeping. The metro station outside the hotel was still closed, but there was another station 5 minutes walk away, so we still travelled around easily. I

Reviews.Title: “Appreciated the service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: chush
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in the hotel. Staff is extremely helpful and go out or their way to assist you. Rooms are clean and breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bandit7199
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 night stay at the Milton Roma. First, the staff was very helpful from the moment we checked in. They went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. The room was not large by any means, but it was adequate for our stay. As many others have already stated, the shower situation is just plain weird. We just accepted the fact that the floor was going to be soaking wet when we finished our showers. The breakfast was really good. There was a wide selection including bacon, breakfast pizza, croissants, etc... Finally, the location was just fine. You can walk out of the hotel and be at the Colosseum within 15 minutes or be at the next Metro stop within 10 minutes. The Metro stop in front of the hotel still is not open. I read a bulletin at one of the other Metro stations that said the opening was being delayed due to archeoligical discoveries while constructing the station. Overall, the Milton Roma was a great place to stay. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: tessykins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Milton for a week during July of this year, along with my sister and her partner, and I have to say that it was certainly great value for money. I was a little woried about the location of the hotel having read many reviews on this site complaining about the poor location, however I was delighted at how convenient the hotel was. Ok, it was a little far to walk to many sights, but it was very handy to the Collessum (max 15mins) and the nearest subway, which I found the best and cheapest way of getting around Rome, is only a five minute walk away - this, of course, will change when the Manzoni station opens and will mean that the nearest subway will be less than a minute away. I mean, what more could you want Our room was perfectly adequate. When we booked the hotel (via Venere.com), I asked for rooms facing onto the courtyard (an attempt to avoid the din from the noisy streets running alongside the hotel) and I'm happy to report that our request was granted with an added bonus for my sister and her partner who managed to get a room with a large balcony. Our room also faced out onto the balcony (the only one in the hotel I think) but we couldn't access it unless we climbed out the window! Our room numbers were 128 and 130 (as far as I can remember) and would be ideal if, like us, you are travelling in a group of four as we were able to sit out on the balcony at nighttime and enjoy the warm night air. On the topic of warmth and heat, the only real downside to this hotel is the noise of the air conditioner and, as we stayed during July, it was necessary to have the ac on all night in order to guarantee any kind of sleep. My advice to you is to bring ear plugs otherwise you could be in for some very restless nights. Breakfast was included with our booking and, again, was perfectly satisfactory. Of course, the now infamous coffee was a little disappointing but, hey, we were in Rome and could find a perfectly good coffee just about anywhere so were easily able to make up for the lukewarm and watery offering elsewhere. There's not much nightlife around the hotel so we forked out on a taxi most nights to the Trastevere area (an absolute must when you go to Rome - delicious restaurants and incredibly lively). The taxi fare was anything from 10-15 euros each way(depending on traffic), but this was shared between four of us so didn't work out to be too expensive. There is a gorgeous restaurant just a stone's throw away from the hotel called Romantica (or something along the lines of that), it wasn't overly expensive and the profiteroles are absolutely to die for!! Just head towards the Vittorio Emmanuelle subway, walk about 100 yards from the hotel and its on your right hand side (I promise that I don't work for this restaurant or anything, I'm simply plugging it because of those heavenly desserts!!) Anyway. overall I was delighted with the Hotel Milton and will definitely stay there again if I ever return to Rome (I did throw a euro into the Trevi Fountain so I had better return!)

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the instant coffee at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mattinbrum
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the comments so far. Lovely up-to-date rooms, good location, helpful staff. The breakfast offered a good selection but I found it strange that Italians should serve awful instant coffee out of a machine - the orange juice wasn't fresh either.

Reviews.Title: “Metro Station under repair!”
Reviews.Author: barryontherun
Reviews.Content: Note *** Metro station "Manzoni" next to hotel is still closed, dispite what the web site says *** Staff were friendly, rooms nice, and a very nice breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: salm0
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Milton Roma in early May 2007. While my single room was certainly small, it was very comfortable, I'd say above average, and the breakfast was outstanding, with a huge variety from which to choose. It's a little bit out of the way, if a 15 minute walk from the Colosseum could be called that, but public transport in the city is pretty good so that getting around is hardly a problem, and the price is very reasonable. The staff were friendly, fluent in English and very helpful. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MARodd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Milton Roma during June 2007 and I found the staff to be friendly, the rooms to be big, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a bis on the small side but perfectly adequate. The breakfast was very nice for a contenential breakfast. It's location is a small disadvantage as it takes 20mins to walt to the city centre but that was a minir issue. Overall I would recommend this hotel for a young couple or a lone traveller.

Reviews.Title: “One night in July”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMM
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room in the Milton Roma for one night. The room was a grand size, plenty of room in the bathroom, had a safe etc. The bathroom actually had a decent hairdryer! I had stayed in a 5* hotel the three nights previous, and while the 5* was allot more luxurious, the Milton Rome wasn't too bad in comparison. A more tourist hotel than business hotel, but at least the Milton Roma had a bath in the bathroom! Great after walking Rome all day. The biggest difference i noticed was the noise level in the mornings, you could hear other people's doors opening and closing which woke me up. The breakfast was OK, nothing too special, but had cereals, fruit, hot food etc. The hotel is directly across the road from a metro station, which wasn't in operation while i was there. About a 5 minute walk uphill to the next stop. The hotel was about a 10/15 minute walk from the colosseum and the forum. The staff on reception were very friendly and if you don't plan on spending too much time in your room, it might fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahH_2007
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the hotel, considering we were originally supposed to stay at another hotel, but there were problems with the air con so they moved us to this hotel. Check in was fine, rooms were nice and clean, cleaned every day and had fresh towels each day also. Room was okay for a twin room. Breakfast was great with lots of choice from cereals to pastries. Staff were helpful and friendly. Found everything within walking distance, although the vatican was a little too far but managed to walk to it fine as the weather wasn't too hot, would reccomend going to the vatican around 12ish as we didn't have to queue and only waited for about 5-10 mins to get a ticket once inside. The colosseum is short walk away 10-15 mins. The only complaint was that the bathroom floor got drenched when having a shower as it was a plastic screen on the side of the bath and the shower was in the wrong place, had to put towels on the floor to stop it from leaking all over the place. All in all an enjoyable stay in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly & knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: suzysue2
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to finally decide on a hotel in Rome, partly due to the bad reviews I had read on various web sites about an aweful lot of the city centre hotels. Finally I decided on the Milton Roma & have to say that it was everthing I and my travelling companions could have wished for! As soon as we arrived, and we were earlier than the suggested check in time, we were shown to one of the rooms allocated to us so we could leave the bags etc. The other room wasn't ready at the time but would be on our return. Reception staff helped us with metro and bus routes etc. The hotel is a little way out of the City centre, it was a short walk up hill to the metro station and a 10 min ride to the Spanish steps. When the Metro by the hotel re-opens this will make it better placed. We walked 10 mins from the hotel and arrived at the Colluseum, nice flat easy walk but still a way out of the city. Hotel rooms were a little noisy as the other reviews had suggested but this is a capitol city! you should expect some noise surely? Rooms were spotlessly clean, not enormous but more than adequate. Tea and coffe making in room which was an unexpected nice touch, mini bar also. TV only had news channel in English but we had come to see the sights and not watch telly! Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice, continental of course, if you are expecting full English then this is not the choice for you! (book into Road chef!!) We got a deal with the breakfast included through Venere.com, it was 20Euros otherwise, a bit steep we thought for a bit of cereal & cuppa! Didn't eat in the evening at the hotel, we went around the Trevi and Sapnish steps, found some fab little places of the beaten track, have a look around before deciding. All in all , a lovely hotel with very friendly, helpful staff, would definatley go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: elemschoolmarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milton Roma for three nights this week. I took the advice of others on Trip Advisor and agree that it is a wonderful hotel. The rooms were clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious and beautifully presented. It was in walking distance of ancient Rome and the bus was convenient. It is good to buy the all day bus pass from the hotel for E4. The buses run until midnight. One suggestion is to use the internet cafe right behind the hotel as it is about 1/4 the price of the one in the hotel lobby. We will definately plan to stay at the Milton Roma again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place”
Reviews.Author: badwyer
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here for 3 nights near Xmas 2006. The inside of the hotel is essentially brand new. Each of my 3 boys got their own room, which they loved. Both the singles and the double rooms are small but this is very typical for Europe and--who cares? You are going there for the city and not to spend time in a hotel. We had no problem with the location. There were perfectly acceptable restaurants and gelaterias in the immediate neighborhood, which also seemed quiet and safe. It was an easy walk to the Coliseum for our family and we continued walking further to the Forum and then the Pantheon before taking a bus home. There is a Metro station across the street (Manzoni) but it was being renovated when we were there. Anyway, the Metro in Rome is not extensive. It was only a 10-minute walk to the next closest station when we took the Metro to go to the Vatican. The Basilica of San Clemente is extremely close to the hotel and is definitely worth seeing. The hotel is also close to St. John’s in Laterano. The breakfast buffet was phenomenal and we usually ate enough to avoid eating again until close to dinner. One of my kids is a picky eater, but there were a variety of choices to satisfy even him. They didn’t have orange juice but instead had ACE juice, which is a mixture of carrot, and other juices that was surprisingly good. We didn’t have much contact with the staff but when we did, they were pleasant and helpful. Some people might find the street noise a bit loud. We were on the second floor and the noise didn’t bother any of us, but it was December and our windows were closed. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and we would definitely go back if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Could find no faults”
Reviews.Author: Kazzer1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice. It was exceptionally well kept and very nicely decorated. The room was presented well..................very comfortable beds and proper pillows! Tea and coffee making facilities and a minibar plus flat screen TV (not many English speaking channels though). The bathroom was very clean........towels changed every day. The hotel's cleanliness was excellent. Breakfast consisted of fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, bacon,cereals, toast, yoghurts, juices. The staff were courteous and very helpful and friendly. The location was good but unfortunately the Metro station outside the hotel was closed due to ongoing repairs. The next nearest one was Vittorio Emanuelle but this wasn't far to walk. We had dinner in two nice restaurants which were recommended by the hotel receptionist Fabio. One of them was just a short walk away and was called 'something Bianco. The translation was The White Horse. The food and service was excellent. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mr7958
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel just outside the centre of the city, but within ten minutes walk of the colloseum and fifteen minutes of the city centre. I had a single room which was small but clean and extremely comfortable. It overlooked the courtyard and was absolutely silent at night. The roads nearby did not seem unduly busy to me for Rome - the hotel does not appear to be on one of the main roads in or out of town. The breakfast was good with a wide selection of hot and cold food, but the coffee (especially the cappucino) was pretty poor, especially by Italian standards. Best of all about this hotel were the staff. They were friendly, spoke excellent English (much better than my phrasebook Italian) and extremely helpful. I would certainly return to the Hotel Milton in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel, except for its location”
Reviews.Author: dartagnanaguilar
Reviews.Content: as soon as the metro stop right across this hotel opens, milton roma would probably the best value for money hotel in rome. hotels in rome are quite pricey. and most of the time, you don't get what you pay for. but with milton roma, though it was my most expensive hotel from my europe trip, the service, breakfast, room cleanliness were worth every euro. they even asked whether i would like to be picked up from the airport when i booked my stay. which i did and the 55 euros was worth it because at least i didn't have to find the hotel knowing that because of its location it may be hard to find. the nearest metro is quite a walk, about 2-3 blocks away in a residential part of rome. rome's metro can become chaotic. the new york subway doesn't even compare. the staff is very nice, professional and helpful. the first thing they did when i checked in was to orient me on where the nearest stop was and how to get to the city's attractions through a map that they provided. though my room was small, i absolutely loved it. it was clean and modern, yet somehow it had character. check out their display of toiletries in the bathroom. i thought it was cool. the shower though was tiny, even for a small asian like me. it was hard to navigate the shower so that water won't spill over. but it's no biggie. the breakfast was well worth it because it really had variety. bring your british or american adaptors because they hotel doesn't provide one and unfortunately they don't have english programs so you'd end up watching an all italian tv program.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book a single room!”
Reviews.Author: Babycainsmith
Reviews.Content: The rooms for singles are teeny tiny. I've stayed in small rooms but this one takes the cake. I switched to a larger room and it was fine. The bathrooms and linens are great. The rooms were clean and had everything you could ask for. HUGE problem though... the windows aren't soundproofed. This hotel sits on a corner of two very busy streets and all you hear all day (and night) is traffic. Bring earplugs... it's bad. The neighborhood is lacking the typical charm you can find in other parts of the city. The breakfast is huge and fabulous though.. for 20 Euro it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterS2007
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia as a birthday present for my boyfriend after reading reviews on tripadvisor, and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk to Vittorio Emmanuel metro station and is 1 stop down from Termini (metro opposite hotel still closed). From the outside the hotel looked great and it was just as good inside. The staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfast was a very good buffet with lots of choice, the breakfast room was light and airy. Our room was at the back of the hotel on the ground floor, it was nice, quiet (away from traffic - only sirens could be heard) and was kept clean and towels replaced. Very good location, only 15 minutes walk from Colosseum, we walked and or got the metro. Watch out for pickpockets on crowded metro trains or trams, try and get on at either end rather than going for the middle carriages.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perhaps not the best area”
Reviews.Author: s_neill
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 60 minutes prior to check-in (our flight had been cancelled and, as we were flying with a budget airline, we had to make our own accommodation arrangements) and had no problem upon arrival. After four days walking in Rome and five hours in an airport queue (see bracketed comment above) we - or, more to the point, our feet - really needed some home comforts, i.e. a comfortable bed, and this hotel certainly didn't disappoint. The interior is beautifully decorated, and the rooms are excellent. LCD televisions (reception not the best), comfortable, immaculate beds, and a bathroom you would do well to beat. Breakfast is of the continental type and serves from 7-11, although the staff are a little eager to tidy up after 10.30! My only criticism would be it's location. Although it's a 15 minute walk from Termini - the main train station, which is dodgy area to be in of an evening - we didn't feel too safe walking the streets when returning of a night time. That apart, it's a very, very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good find”
Reviews.Author: cen6cw
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Expedia and got a good price. This was my first trip to Rome and I felt responsibility weighing heavily as I also wanted to book a room for my aunt who we were meeting in Rome and I didn't want to let her down with a crumby room or hotel. No problem! Hotel was new and was formerly a convent so expect pointy windows and high ceilings. Interior decor is excellent. The bedrooms are very well appointed with flat screen tv and tea/coffee making facilities which is much appreciated when you have come in from pounding the streets of Rome and you need a cup of tea. The bathroom was clean, new and had everything you could want, good shower and bath included too, so that was all sorted. Now, breakfast is important to get you off to a flying start and again this did not disappoint. I liked the extended hours of breakfast from 7 until 11am, very generous. Good breakfast spread, fruit juices, breads, cereals and scrambled eggs/bacon, toast, cake all served in a pleasant and airy room. Glad I chose this hotel and glad my aunt approved I would use this hotel again. The metro stop is directly outside the hotel and this is stop 'Manzoni', it is being repaired and is currently closed but you can walk to the next stop at S. Giovanni in Laterano which will take about 15 minutes. When this stop is open again it will be ideal for getting to all the important sites and getting you back to the hotel at the end of a long day. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Everyone
Reviews.Content: Four of us (two couples) from England, spent the 21 - 25 Feb 2007 at this hotel, some what swayed by the other postive views expressed by other travellers; we were not disappointed. The service was good, with helpful staff, from the front desk to the bar lady; all responded well and were keen to make our stay enjoyable. Walking to either metro station was not a problem (the one opposite is still being repaired). We did walk miles, or so it seemed but then this is Rome and not London, so with comfortable shoes, water and a map you should be fine. I'm almost 64 with knees that are a problem to me. The youngest of our four was 59, and we all did OK with managing the many steps, queing and standing around taking in the talks and views. We used the train to come into Rome from FCO airport, and a taxi from the main station in to the Milton, and then the shuttle back from the hotel on Sunday leaving Rome. The queing, almost wherever you go, is considerable. We were told that a few years ago 400,000 visitors came to Rome, now due to the film Gladiators and Dan Brown et-al, this figure has grown to 4,000,000. We gave up on the Friday trying to access the Vatican Museum (VM) having arrived at 10.20! Succeeded on Saturday but this time arrived at 9.00, having breakfasted much earlier. Talking about food the hotel is only BB, but the BB should be read as Big Breakfast! They are good! We walk from the hotel to all the sights having prepared the night before with the map provided by the hotel and a guide book we took with us. We did see the Colosseum many times on our way back to the hotel. To visit the VM (both times) we used the Metro, changing at the main station, which was very simple to do. My italian is about four words, but what a difference it makes to try. So, do greet people and say goodbye, it is appreciated and does wonders for the service received. Small complaint, no observation about the hotel, the rooms are fairly hot at night and openning the windows is great for fresh air BUT does let in the road noise. Otherwise a great stay, both at the Hotel MIlton and Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very pleased”
Reviews.Author: CRDUSA
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (with two children ages 4 and 7) and spent Feb 18-23 at the Hotel Milton. We thought it was a great place. We were given an outstanding room in the back of the hotel with a queen-size bed and two twin beds. The room was a great size. The children had their own little area across from a spotless bathroom with nice fixtures and a hair dryer. Noise, because we were in the back, was never a problem Plus: 1. Cleanliness of hotel, size of room, newness of hotel. 2. Breakfast (I've read on this site where the breakfast was said to be "outstanding". I wouldn't go that far. It was okay, the pastries were uninspiring. But, there is enough choice to satisfy most anyone. The children were content with the chocolate rice krispies). 3. There is a telephone/internet place a few doors to the left if you exit on Emanuele Filiberto. This is an unbelievable convenience if you need to call internationally. It was rather cheap (if calling the U.S., you have to dial 001, area code and number, press the button on the phone after connection, then pay the attendant when done). 4. Additionally, right next door, and to the left on Emanuele Filiberto, is a Tabacchi where you can buy bus, tram, and metro tickets. Also, you can buy little souvenirs. Minuses: 1. Coffee. I have stayed in pensions and little hotels in Italy before and the morning coffee was outstanding. At the Milton, the coffee is self-service, comes out of a machine, and it was not good. I would have preferred, for breakfast, no choice and instead, been given great coffee in individual pots, with fresh pastries and various Italian breads. 2. Area. Don't let this dissuade you from staying at the Milton. It isn't all that bad. However, you are in a little bit of "no man's" land. It's a good 15-20 minute walk from Termini, and a 20 minute walk to the Colosseum. However, there is a bus, right across the street, and to the left, on Emanuele Filiberto, that will take you to Termini, and from there you can go anywhere (with a free transfer to bus or subway, 75 minutes after you initially validate your ticket in the yellow machine in the back of the bus). To the right when exiting on Manzoni, you'll find an assortment of buses, some that will take you to the Colosseum. The Manzoni subway stop across the street is still closed (if you have read prior reviews, you know this a thousand times already). However, the subway does not help very much for the historic sites. We took it once to go directly to the Spanish Steps. Other than that, I don't think you need the Metro at all. Stick to the buses. Miscellaneous notes: 1. We contracted with Rome Shuttle Limousine (do a Google search) to get us from Fiumincino (da Vinci) to the hotel. It was 35 Euros, an excellent bargain from what I've heard, compared to regular taxi and other services. I would have taken the express train to Termini, but since I was told I was going to have to pay for the children, financially and practically, a car service made much more sense. 2. I found the bus situation very confusing. I was never able to find a schedule, although I learned, on the last day, that I could have purchased a "bus route" map at the Tabacchi which gives a listing of the bus routes and numbers. That may have helped, although the map is so tiny that it was difficult to read even in the best of light. On my next trip to Rome, I will be better prepared for the buses. Do some work on the buses before you get there. 3. My face was in the city map so much, it was ridiculous. Walking around was the best, but the streets can be so confusing (they change names frequently, they end suddenly, they do whatever, etc., which makes Rome so charming). The map from the hotel is good (I had at least two on me at all times and got fresh ones everyday, because by the end of each day, I destroyed at least two). I would carry another map that you find beneficial. Maps are not always they same, and different ones can help you find different things. Also, when it gets dark, the maps become difficult to read. Rome is one dark city in the evening. Bring a small flashlight for reading the map at night. I wish I did. Also, a flashlight always seems to come in handy in a hotel room, especially if you want to get out early while others are still sleeping. 4. Eating. Since we over-ate at breakfast, we just had a small snack for lunch (slice of Pizza, folded together, and some espresso at various times during the day). Even though we are a family with young children, we tried to be like Romans and eat late at restaurants, although we still got there on the early side (around 7:30 when most re-open for dinner). If you want a real Roman experience that will bring tears to your eyes, eat at Ristorante der Pallaro, a block south of Corso Vittorio Emmanuele, located on Largo del Pallaro 15, north of Campo de' Fiori. There is no menu; they bring you courses of what they have cooked that day. It was an unbelievable experience and the proprietor, a woman who wears a kerchief around her head, will make you really feel like you've chosen the most authentic place. Rick Steves recommended this restaurant, and now, I am a big fan of his, and trust his judgment on food (that's how I found all of my restaurants and loved every one) and other matters. 4. Money. Be vigilant of pickpockets. I was very careful, looked around a lot and tried to not look like, or act like, a tourist (although the map being stuck to my face may have given me away a bit). My ATM card worked fine, although make sure you only have a four digit PIN, as I was told that more than that will not allow your card to work in foreign (non US) ATMs. Let your credit card companies and bank know that you will be away so they don't freeze you up, fearing fraudulent activity. 5. Kids (you can stop reading if this doesn't concern you). We live in NYC so our kids are used to walking a lot, and they were real troopers as we ran them around this fabulous city. We got our kids "journals" and they pasted/taped post cards, restaurant cards, sugar packets, leaves from Villa Borghese, etc. into the book. They did drawings, and writings (the 7 year old did a real diary). This kept them occupied at various times (especially during the witching hour when we were waiting to be served in restaurants) and allowed us to relax in a square while the kids worked on the journals. We didn't go to the children's museum (what's the point? We're in Rome). We didn't do the Time Elevator, although that may have been fun, especially if your children are older. Children, under 10 are free on public transportation. Our kids got in free at The Vatican Museums, but had to pay at the Colosseum. Children have to pay at Galleria Borghese, I was told (we did not go there). I don't know the rhyme or reason as to when children pay and don't pay. But, they did not have to pay on the 110, Hop On, Hop Off bus, which is a good way to see the city. If you get on very early in the day, it's worth it, although, the stops are hard to find and the bus only runs in one direction. Again, if you master the city buses, you probably won't need the 110. Our kids did all right adjusting to the time, but slept late every day. Not too bad (if you are a two parent family) to have one parent stay behind and allow the other to go out and explore early. That's what we did and it worked out great. Have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Preago
Reviews.Content: Agree with everything that has already been said. Manzoni metro still not open but if you want to get to Colloseum and save tired legs jump on the No 3 bus outside (which appears to be free). Also going back to Termini, use the No 360 bus across the road. Train back to airport was 11 Euros each, quicker and cheaper than the taxi and takes you straight into terminal. If you fancy clubbing there doesn't seem to be anything for miles around, something to do with a law about dancefloors !!!! Very odd. Instead we went to Sloppy Sams in Campo di Fiori, great night out, lively, mixed age and nationality. Left at 2:30am and easily got a taxi for 8 Euros to hotel. Buy a metro all day ticket from tobacco shop next door as there is never anyone at the metro stations to buy from (4 Euros). Breakfast is a must and on till 11am which is good after a late night out !! Rome was busy even in February, can't imagine what it would be like in the summer. Waited over an hour at St Peters to walk up the dome, but worth it. Very narrow, tight steps, no good if you are claustrophic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Milton”
Reviews.Author: w9628983
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, after reading the reviews here we booked for a long weekend. We arrived on Easyjet at the Fiorentino airport and paid 13 euros for a return ticket on the bus. A 10 minute walk from termini found us at Hotel Milton. The immediate impression is clean and tidy and the staff were fantastic, provided a map and where everything was. Upon advice in the column we had requested a room at the back, which was provided, and I do recommend it because we could still feel the faint rumblings of the tram. Room was newly refurbished - Bathroom was fantastic. The Bar area was cozy and provided you free food and a good selection of drinks and the breakfast was very good too. We walked everywhere from this hotel - the colloseum is 10 minutes, half an hour got us to Saint Peters. If you want a tip, go to saint peters at 7pm at night, its deserted and even more magical. Cannot recommend this place enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Headaway
Reviews.Content: Hotel Milton Roma has much to commend it. Our room was newly refurbished to a high standard, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff were courteous and very helpful, and there is an excellent breakfast buffet. The hotel is a short walk from the nearest metro station and one can easily walk to the Colosseum. The only negative points are that some of the streets immediately around the hotel are a bit grim, and our room was exposed to quite a lot of traffic noise. Also note that, on departure, if you are getting a cab to Termini station in order to pick up the airport bus, be very clear that you only want to go Termini. We almost had to resort to violence to get our cab driver to take us where we wanted, and not to his choice of destination!

Reviews.Title: “Better than average at attractive price”
Reviews.Author: hendric
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends for 3 nights at this hotel. The location is a little on the edge of inner city but most places can be reached at reasonable taxi fare. To the Colloseum, Piazza Venezia, Forum Romanum, San Giovanni in Lalerano (Famous church) as well as the bid daily clothing market you can walk to. Once the Metro station outside the Hotel is open again(might take many more months) you can reach a lot of other important places by metro. Now you would have to walk 7-10 minutes to the next metro station. The rooms are comfortable and the bathrooms are spacious for Rome hotels. The breakfast is excellent compared to other hotels in Rome. The prices for mini bar and the hotels small bar are exorbitant. Room service was very, very slow!! By 4 a clock in the afternoon our room was still not made up! The hotel staff is friendly and helpful but gave us (deliberately?) the wrong information on taxi prices to the airport. We were told that a taxi from the hotel to Ciampino airport would be approx. 60 Euros when it turned out to be 30 Euros. I think they were trying to sell us their own hotel shuttle service at 65 Euro s and nearly succeeded. Unfortunately the Hotel does not mention anywhere in there publicity or own website that it is a NON SMOKING HOTEL. This could cause great inconvenience to some and should be clearly announced in advance. I still can recommend this hotel for its price, size of rooms and reasonable location. You should ask for rooms facing the inner courtyard or you may have some sleepless nights. (This is often the case in city hotels)

Reviews.Title: “Great location & breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: N&GB6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the breakfast fab with plenty of choice. Ahough the bedroom was small it was cleaned every day, with fresh towels and bedding. The hotel is in a great location, 10mins walk to Colleseium and 10 mins to Metro (the one directly across the road is being reconstructed). Staff friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jane_1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent!! The hotel is right next to a metro stop (manzoni), however this was closed during our stay. The next nearest metro stop is about 5-10 mins walk (vittorio emanuele), which is one stop from the main station. Turn left when you come out of the hotel & go straight on. We stayed there for 3 nights. Check in was very easy & the staff were very helpful giving us map & pointing out all the sights. The bedroom was very clean & we thought it was spacious for a city hotel. Rooms cleaned every day/fresh towels/bar refilled etc. Breakfast was exceptional, pastries; hot cooked food, cheeses/ham, fruit, juices, and hot drinks…. As for location the hotel is a ten min walk from the colosseum. We used the metro frequently but a lot of the sites are not on the met line. In which case we walked instead of using the buses. I think wherever you stay in Rome you will have a walk from site to site. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome, just be aware it is on a main road & you do get noise from the traffic. I’m not the deepest sleeper & it didn’t bother me! Tips: Line A closes at 9pm until 2008 due to works being carried out & take your passport or credit card to museums if you wish to get audio guides (for a deposit) or under 26's discounts!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: E-DiFranco
Reviews.Content: My husband found this hotel online..."an inexpensive hotel ,with clean rooms and a very helpful and friendly staff." And if that is what you're looking for in Rome, then here it is. However, if you're looking for atmosphere, originality, something purely "Italian" then this is not the place. We were hoping for a hotel that was more "authentic", the Milton seemed very American/Italian. There also is a lot of road noise. The Milton is at an intersection of some major streets, so expect lots of traffic. It was very convienent to a lot of attractions, the Colleseum is a ten minute walk, many shops all close. Although we never ate in their restaurant, it was very pretty, and smelled yummy! We won't stay there again, purely because it isn't very quaint, or different, though it is very, very clean. Everyone we met at desk where all very helpful and eager to please. They also all knew some English, and were willing to try to understand your Italian! We loved the people!

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Paukenguy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a great stay at the Milton Roma. Before I get to the good stuff there are two drawbacks we encountered. 1) The metro stop right in front of the hotel is NOT open. 2) We had a corner first floor room. During the day which was fine, but at night, a tram car runs on the street at night. It kept both my wife and I awake the first night, manly because we were not expecting it. We asked to change rooms, but they were not able to accommodate us. I would just recommend to stay away from the ground floor street side of the building. That being said. I don’t think we could do any better for $90/night. Rooms we perfectly clean and very pleasant. Great morning breakfast and a very nice staff. I don’t know where else atleast for this rate you could find such a nice hotel, and because of that I would stay there again. The location does have it’s issues. But, once you discover the 85 and 87 busses you’ll be zooming around the city. Taxis are also fairly reasonable around the city. Finally it is very easy to get to the hotel from the Airport via the train and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Freinds for NYE2007”
Reviews.Author: MaxVG
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 days at the Milton from 3 0.12 to 03.01. The hotel is well enough. Breakfast is a very good, much better than in other Italian hotels. Internet is rather expansive but very close are few internet cafes. It placed very near Collosium but far from other main attractions, anyway if you are young and ready to walk a lot - it o.k. (as we were). After the long walking days you can pick up the taxi and get back for 10-15 EUR from any place in central part of city. The metro station Manzoni is still closed. Next is 5 minutes away but you do not need the metro to explore the Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good experience”
Reviews.Author: Jezz
Reviews.Content: My wife have just returned after 4 night/5 days in Rome and stayed at the Milton Roma. It's a great hotel. Rooms are clean and the size is fine. Actually everything is great about this hotel. Room, bathroom, breakfast - only thing which was really, really awful was the noise from the road during the night. I normally sleep like a rock but woke up a min. of 4 times every night, when the trams came rolling :( A set of noise proof windows instead of single glas windows would improve it a lot, or get a room facing the away from the street. But again... besides the noise from the street I have NOTHING to complaing about.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Excellent Service, Location, & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: smikho
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for our honeymoon. I am 31 and my wife is 26, a Canadian couple, and newly weds. The location was excellent as we had access to a subway station, and a number of bus routes. Bottom line is, we were never worried about transportation. A 15-minutes walk from the Colloseum, everything was within reach and close by, nice restaurants few blocks away. The room's size was fair, which allowed comfort. An LCD TV! and a great marble bathroom, extra clean! The room was queen size bedded. The breakfast was good and fresh; we didn't need to go outside for breakfast. The receptionists were phenomenal, I can't thank them enough for their kindness, helpfulness and welcoming attitude. They spoke great English, and they provided us with great deal of information about everything we needed, they were our service guide and our source of tourist guidance. We would like to specially thank FABIO and SEMONE, very nice guys, well spoken and highly knowledgeable about the city's attractions and services. We hope that they will be recognized by their managers as they are professional hosts. We will DEFINITELY stay there should we go to Roma again. Ciao Bella Roma Sal and Kris

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Oodie222
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was good value for money. We had a clean and spacious room, and perhaps the Hotel was recently refurbished. It is close to the Colloseum but it is a fair walk to the city centre and eateries. Most restaurants close from 3:30pm-7pm so if you are looking for dinner around the area, you will have to wait for the few around the area to open. The metro was still closed and if you catch a taxi from the Hotel to the city centre, it will cost you approx. 10Euros. We went at a time when the streets were chaotic with the recent presidential elections. Service at this Hotel was ok. Can't really say that reception staff were truly helpful - we know we have had better. Staff seemed to lack a friendly smile, not sure if this is just the Roman way! Breakfast was sumptuous though.

Reviews.Title: “Not for solo travellers”
Reviews.Author: McKaye
Reviews.Content: I can happily confirm that ricky9301´s review was right: This was the smallest hotel-room I ever had. It was about the size of others hotel´s bathrooms (look at the photos!). The location of the hotel is okay, not 500m to the colosseum but 1km, but thats okay. CheckIn was quite fast and I was given a free map, nice gesture... The room was small, as being said but positivley silent at night, since it faced the patio. Bathroom was way to small. I managed to touch both shower walls with my shoulders at the same time! And I´m not large or X-Large as you might think. Breakfast was quite plentiful, but the coffee was bad, since it came from an automativ machine. Overall it was not terrible, but I´m sure you can get better rooms in rome for less money. Just avoid the single rooms next to the elevator (the x32 rooms).

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Guy33
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the milton for 4 nights and had a great time.we arrived at about 3pm and checked in straight away.we were given all the tourist info and a porter brought our bags to our room.we had a room overlooking the courtyard so we had no problem with noise apart from the churchbells ringing in the evening.the rooms are all brand new and very clean even if they are a bit on the small side but it doesn't matter because the staff are great and the breakfast is even better. it's only about a 10 min walk to the colosseum and a 20 min walk to the piazza navona.we used the 87 bus a lot.come out of the hotel,take a right,and the bus stop is just past the first set of traffic lights.it will take you right into the centre.if you eat good stay away from the tourist traps and ask the hotel staff to recommend somewhere. i really couldn't find any faults with the hotel and i would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to have a great time in rome for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, pleasurable, good value”
Reviews.Author: London_E14
Reviews.Content: This popular hotel deserves its credit. Modern (newhotel formerly a convent). Quality rooms and service. Above all the price was good value. Book in advance as they are popular and usually fully booked. Loved the breakfast. Great for all types of travellers. Its not far from either the main Termini station or the Colossium. Its next to the Manzoni subway/underground station which, at the time of our visit in Nov'06, had been closed for maintenance for several months. But its still only a 5-10 minute walk from the next nearest stop: Vittorio E.

Reviews.Title: “One night at Milton Roma”
Reviews.Author: seanmcl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. The hotel is in a good location but unfortunately is by a busy road junction with trams which meant I had a disturbed night's sleep. The bedrooms and bathrooms are small. The staff are professional and friendly. The breakfast was better than many Italian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Milton”
Reviews.Author: zoefran
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the Milton for 3 nights. The staff make this hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they went over and above anything asked of them. I have stayed in 5* hotels in Rome and the Milton beat any of them for the care that the staff take to serve the guests. Breakfast is very adequate for an "Italian Breakfast" and the food was quickly replenished. All in all this is a find in a city overrun with average 4* hotels. The rooms are not huge but they are perfecty clean + have very good amenities. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel Great Breafast”
Reviews.Author: BoomerTravel
Reviews.Content: Take a taxi from Termini Sation to get there. To far to walk with bags. A new hotel which must of recently opened. Automatic doors lead you into the lobby and front desk. Got there around two from Florence and had to wait for an hour for the room to be ready. Still a little disorganized, but staff were extremely friendly. Elevator ride to second floor to a very clean carpeted newly decorated room. Very comfortable bed with with flat screen TV. The room was tight but big enough. Bathroom was a good size very clean bright lighting big sink with a real hair dryer for my wife and a shower curtain which could of been wider to keep water off the floor. Location to the sites was great. Short walk to the Colosseum and the forum. Pantheon and Trevi are also all within walking distance. Alot of geat places to eat, drink wine or get gelato in Pantheon/Trevi area. The breakfast at the hotel was the best we had during out trip throughout Italy. Big bright dining room with tablecloths. Alot of varety of food to choose from. When they ran out of an item they were quick to bring out more. Great quality and excellent coffee. Front desk got us a taxi quickly.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: ajbsh
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with Expedia and got a great rate of 5 nights for the price of 4! The hotel is situated on the corner of a busy crossroads, and yes, the noise carries on throughout the night between cars, trams and buses. However we managed to sleep as our home is situated on a busy street so it was fine for us, but do take earplugs if noise bothers you. There are 2 metro stations nearby, both on the Metro A line, and a 10 minute walk either uphill or downhill depending on which one you go for. The hotel will benefit greatly when the Manzoni Metro station opens because it is literally across the street. We found a couple of really great Pizzeria and Pasta places nearby and the food was fabulous. The hotel was within walking distance to the Colosseum, approx. 10 - 15 minutes away. The reception staff were fantastic, very efficient and greeted us with a free map of Rome and told us how to get to the nearest attractions. They also helped us contact our airline when our luggage went missing. Our room was spotlessly clean, not the biggest room I've stayed in but we were in Rome to sight see not stay in our room. Ample storage space for luggage and a small safe (no use for a laptop). As well as CNN we also discovered MTV which had some english speaking shows on our LCD tv. The bathroom was great, very clean, no shower curtain but again this didn't bother us, its a minor inconvenience that's all. The hotel bar opens in the evening, and is very small but service was great with a good choice of drinks and light snacks. You can either charge it to your room or pay, as we did, direct. On the whole the hotel was fab, staff were very efficient and the hotel was very clean. The only thing that we noticed that had been advertised as being in our room but wasn't was a coffee tray - so what! Great coffee across the road, oh and gelato - mmmmm!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: markrlloyd
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Milton with only 6 days to go before leaving (an impulsive last-minute decision). I was generally very pleased with my stay. Location is a little bit out; the Colosseum is the nearest major tourist site & is a 10 to 15 minute walk away. I'm usually a very fast walker, but in the heatwave of late July I couldn't do anything at speed! Termini Station is a 15 to 20 minute walk away. Manzoni metro station is directly opposite, but is closed for restoration until later in the year. To be honest I only used it once to go to Ottavia for The Vatican, & just walked up to Vittorio metro station to get on. Staff were very polite and freindly, without exception. Room reminded me of a Thistle Hotel (if you're from the UK that'll hopefully give you an idea of the quality). As others mentioned, it's not so much a minibar as a fridge full of a few soft drink cans & bottled water. Room was fully air conditioned, but was quite noisey throughout the day and night, as it is located on the corner of two roads. Reception is 24 hour (I came in at almost 2 AM one night). My bathroom DID have a shower curtain, but due to poor design water still leaked out on to the bathroom floor, so by the time I'd finished there was a paddling pool to mop up with spare towels! Breakfast exceeded my expectations; a choice of fresh fruit, cereals, yoghurts, sliced meats and cheeses, toast, juice, coffee and various pastries. Cheap way to fill yourself before setting out for the day. I fully intend to visit Rome again (it's the best city I've ever visited, & I've been to a few now) and will definately choose the Hotel Milton again.

Reviews.Title: “So what there was no shower curtain....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok so it is weird not to have a shower curtain but once you get over this minor detail, the hotel had everything else going for it. My boyfriend and I stayed in Rome a couple of days before getting on a cruise ship. This hotel is close by the Colosseum (sp) and new so we went with it. The breakfast is awesome: scrambled eggs, bacon, lunchemeat to make sandwiches for later....good stuff. I would stay here again, very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TAM1764
Reviews.Content: Me, my partner and his parents stayed at this hotel and would thoroughly recommend it. There was some ongoing work at the hotel but this was not detrimental to our stay. It is very clean, welcoming and comfortable and our rooms could not be faulted. The staff were very helpful and professional. The breakfast facilities were excellent with a varied variety of foods to suit all requirements. The location of the hotel is superb - the Coloseum being only a short walk away. We will probably visit Rome again and will be staying at this hotel as it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome....Disappointed with hotel”
Reviews.Author: miked102
Reviews.Content: Firstly Rome is fantastic... if you are thinking about going..DO! Just a shame the hotel did not fit the bill. Previous reviews outlined a few teethng problems such as shower curtains/screens which were not really a problem. The buffet breakfast is great and the location is a wee bit out but not bad and close to the Colosseum and Forum. It will improve when the Metro opens accross the road but if you are walking about probably not the best hotel to stay at. The area around the hotel is not the best and there is even spray paint graffeti over the front of the hotel. The mininbar consists of two bottles of water and soft drinks and is not really a bar in any sense of the word. The hotel bar has no atmosphere is closed during the day and you must charge everything to the room! Minor points, but what really disappoints is the refusal of staff to place a surprise engagement ring in the hotel safe because it was 'full' even when I showed them the tiny ring box and the failure of the hot water sysytem so no warm showers or shaving etc, not my idea of a good holiday! To add insult to injury the 6 Euro discount offered by staff was a disgarce. What a disaster! This hotel does try but I'm afraid is not there and will not be for some time... I will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Noz
Reviews.Content: Have just literally returned from 6 days at the Milton Roma - I have nothing but praise for the hotel, the staff, the location. The room was small ....ish.....(I have stayed in smaller ...in the UK so I wasnt complaining!) but spotless and the bathroom was perfect - we had a bath with a shower head which was ideal. The staff were very nice and helpful and as for the breakfast..........they were replenishing right up to the end so no complaints there!!! We had a hotel on the 3rd floor overlooking the courtyard so noise was not an issue. For the money - this hotel is a bargain..... Good luck to it. :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MrBundy
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful visit to a beautiful city in a great Hotel. I admit I was a little skeptical that a 4 star hotel with such a great location was so reasonably priced. At the time we made our reservation there were no comments about the hotel, as it was about to open. After I made the reservation with Hotels, I called the hotel and spoke to Claudia. I explained that I booked a room for 3 Adults and a child. She said that she would look at all the rooms and to find out which room would accommodate our needs. I called her back in a couple of days and she said she found the perfect room and she did. I had also told her the flight we were arriving on. As soon as we had got our luggage and started wheeling it out I saw someone with our name, at that point I knew that I had chosen the right hotel. The hotel was everything that Claudia had promised. Because of the central location of the hotel, we could get everywhere easily. Directions from the hotel staff helped, especially from Emanuele the front desk man. He will go the extra mile to make sure you get to your destination. Everyone was friendly and the afternoon happy hour was great. The breakfast was fresh and plentiful. The maid service was as good as we have had anywhere, if not better. Of course not anything is ever perfect, but all things considered this hotel comes very close. The showers did not have curtains. I asked Claudia why there were no curtains for the shower, she said the enclosures had been ordered and will soon be installed. One thing is for sure, you can not go wrong by staying at The Hotel Milton Roma. If you want a great tour of the Vatican City, call 349 8726 943, the day before you want to the tour and tell them that you want Brandon to give you a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and was very pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff. The just really couldnt do enough for me. Offered me excellent advice for a first timer in Rome. I was able to walk everywhere. Lovely location with several nice local restaurants nearby - nothing like traditional pasta in italy. As the hotel was only just recently opened still a a couple of cosmetic things to happen, but nothing major. The room was very well appointed. Another thing that impressed me was that I was quite unwell during my stay and travelling alone, which can make one feel quite depressed. The hotel was aware that I was resting in my room and checked up on me to make sure that I was ok. Even organising a staff member to bring me tea and a light meal. I will definately stay at this hotel again.
